Author: Coldest Cube
Review Content: My favourite part was when Mercy said “Heroes never die…for a price!”, resurrecting her team but at the cost of cancelling the PVE and making you buy the battlepass.My favorite part was when tracer threw her pulse bomb and said ”wait for it”, just like blizzard made us for 3 and a half years, only to cancel the one thing we were still looking forward to.I loved the part where kiriko said “let the kitsune guide you” and guided the development team away from PVE.I love the moment when reinhart said "six demonic hearts lay in my chest" and then transformed into the higher ups at blizzard and cancelled PVE.I loved when Widow Maker said "No PVE developers can hide from my sight" and she just headshot all of them.I loved it when Rammatra ults and says, “Take everything from them,” as he takes PvE from the game.I loved when Wrecking Ball said, "PvE Denied," and then cancelled it. Such an amazing Blizzard moment.My favorite part was when Sojourn said "This ends now!" And ended PvE development indefinitely. One of the Overwatch moments of all time.I love the part where Junkrat said, "Fire in the hole!" and proceeded to blow up the development of PvE to smithereens.Loved when Moira said "Surrender to my Greed" as she takes the creed and motto of Blizzard to heart and decimates the PVE from existence.I loved the part when Tracer said "time's up" just like our patience for PVE.I loved the part when Zenyatta said “experience disappointment” and proceeded to cancel PVE.I love when Ashe said, “Bob, do something!” And then Bob shot down our hopes of getting PVE.I loved when reaper said "clearing the area" and destroyed all the people and machines working on PVE.I loved the part where Bap said 'I'm only guilty of stealing PVE' then jumped off sanctum.I loved when Zarya said “fire at will” and the executives at blizzard fired all the PVE developers.I loved the part where mei said " it's blizzard time" and she proceeded to freeze the pve developers.When Ashe said she was “heartless” it totally reminds me of blizzard when they stole PvE from us.I loved when Reinhardt said, "HAMMER DOWN!" and stunned the whole PvE team so they couldn't work on it.My absolute favorite part is when Widowmaker said “No can hide from my sight” and then proceeded to see no one working on the PvE campaign.Love it when Orisa said "I have a bad feeling about this" and then Blizzard cancelled PVE. Amazing !I liked the part where Pharah said “injustice rains from above” and let Blizzard cancel PVE.I loved it when mercy said, “sometimes I’m not sure why I even bother” and didn’t even bother with the PVE.I loved the part when Sombra popped her ult and said "Apagando las PvE!" and scrapped what we've been begging for since 2019. Truly a blizzard moment.I love that Reinhardt said “ Are you afraid to fight me” and fought everyone working on pve.I love hearing it whenever Lucio says, "OH LET'S BREAK OUR PLAYERBASE'S TRUST!" Lucio dropped the beat, so hard blizzard had to cancel PVE.I love when genji said “I need pve” and didn’t get it.I loved when Reaper said "BUY! BUY! BUY!" and the item shop appeared and proceeded to tell me every 5 minutes that a 6 year old skin is now in the item shop for 20§ and then PVE got canceled!Loved that time when Orisa said "Meet your fate!" and then PVE met its fate and got smashed into tiny little pieces. Truly one of the moments of all time. I love the part where Reaper says "Die, Die, Die!" then proceeds to kill off the PvE.I LOVED the part where Reinhardt shatters our faith and respect for Blizzard as a company.I loved the part where Lucio said "Oh let's break it DOWN" and broke down the entire community's hopes for a good PvE mode.I love when Hanzo said “Let the dragon consume PvE” and dropped Overwatch players pointless sequel of the original game with battle pass and the shop no one asked for. Truly an Overwatch 2 moment.I loved when roadhog went “unloading scrap” and scrapped the entire pve.I loved when Mercy says “Blizzard always LIES!” And cancelled what a majority of the community was looking forward to.I loved it when DVA said "Activate Self-Destruct Sequence" and blizzard blew up our hopes for pve.I love the part when Junker Queen says, "My PvE is where I say it is!" and points to a dumpster fire.My favourite part was when Ashe shouted "Bob, do nothing!", and Bob decided to stop working on the PVE.I loved it when Torbjörn yelled "molten core!!" and then the cpu cores in the single computer making PvE turned into lava.I loved the part where Sojourn said "Development ends now!" and she proceeded to fire a railgun shot at the last computer working on PVE.I absolutely adore when mercy says "I'll send you my consultation fee!" And proceeds to fee us for the pve, the new characters, and for the new skins.I loved it when witch mercy said "My servants pay in credit" and proceeded to empty everyone's bank account.I love it when zen said “Pass into the unknown” and the PVE team did.Are you wondering why Zenyatta got a Pinocchio skin? That's because Zenyatta lied about the PvE update.I loved when Sigma said “the wallets sing for me” as he used his gravity powers to suck the money from our wallets.I love it when mei said "Freeze dont move" and froze the pve team.I liked the part when Ramattra said "Justice is cruel, it demands a sacrifice" and then he proceeded to sacrifice the pve devs in a ritual.I liked the part where Doomfist said to  Blizzard "such potential... wasted" as Blizzard made OW2 a game missing 80% of its promised features hidden behind 20$ skins.I love when Lucio shouted "Turning up the heat!" and then raised the pressure price to $15 for 3 missions.My favourite part was when Winston said "A better world is impossible today!", as he fails to deliver the PVE to the community.I loved the part when Sombra said “apagando las luces” and completely shut down the skill tree.I love when pharah said "SKILL TREES RAIN FROM ABOVE" and threw all the skill trees outside of Blizzard HQ to be broken and never recovered.I loved when reinhardt shouted "FOR THE BATTLEPASS!" Then proceeded to shatter the pve and skill trees, truly one of the moments of all time.My favorite part is when Zenyatta said “Pass into nothingness” and PVE did exactly that.Loved the part where Genji says “THE DISAPPOINTMENT BECOMES ME!” As he unleashed his dragon blade and slashed away all of the unfinished skill trees and hero missions so that way blizzard could have their well deserved rest for working so hard.Loved the part where Zen says "Experience no accountability!" and then proceeds to scrap pve and sell old skins for 20$.I love when orisa says "BUY A MORE-EH" And proceeds to destroy my bank account and cancels PVE.I loved the part when Sigma said “the money sings to me” and used his ult to send the game improvements to the stratosphere.My favorite part is when Soldier said "I've got you in my sights" little did we know he was talking about everyones wallet he had in his sight.Really loved the part where Mercy said "Profits never die!" as she flies around lifting money from our pockets.When Torb said "MOLTEN LORE" and burned down all the PvE files; it was truly one of the moments of all time.I loved the part where soldier says “remember what we’re fighting for” then abandons PVE.Loved the part where widow said "no one can hide from my sight" referring to everyone's wallets that she can see. Truly a blizzard moment.Loved when pharah said "disappointment rains from above" and proceeded to cancel everything related to PvE.I loved it when Bastion hummed a little tune, and then dropped a mortar on the single computer from 1998 that was working on PVE. Inspirational.My favorite part was when Wrecking Ball said "dropping" and accurately predicted the player count.

Author: Hajime Kashimo
Review Content: To every content creator reading this that "Can't believe people are review bombing the game on steam. Think of the devs." and the worst statement "This season has the most content so far and people are still complaining" WAKE UP or stop lying to your self. OW 1 was ABANDONED for 4 years with 0 content and then blizzard promised a full story mode and talent trees and blah blah blah and then cancelled all of that after changing the game from being 5$ on sale with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ to being free upfront with 19$ skins plus a battle pass. THEN after all that monetization they bring back like 8% of the story mode that was promised and still charge 15 dollars for that AND you cant use coins that you've earned in game to buy the story missions so anyone who has saved up coins from their weekly's, and definitely has enough coins by now to buy this story mission pack if it was 1500 coins instead of 15$, can't buy it without using real money. This season may have "the most content so far" but that isn't saying much seeing as the only thing its adding that the other seasons didn't is the story missions which aren't included in the battle pass. THE STORY MISSIONS ARE SEPARATE FROM THE SEASON. THEY ARE BOUGHT SEPARATELY. This is the same exact thing Destiny 2 does (another game that activision forced to make a sequel when there was no need). In Destiny 2 you have a seasonal battle pass thats 10$ but its separate from the expansions they release every year so you have to pay twice for 1 season of content that should be bundled.Like most other people writing reviews I have tons of hours (1500~on xbox and 1300~on pc) and you are delusional if you think I'm going to write this review like I just started playing the game yesterday and haven't been playing since consol beta and seen all of the good and bad of this game. Also everyone knows it's not the devs fault for most of this stuff (other than hero balance and map/gamemode design) and that all the marketing and business practices are because of the higher ups but thats the people who these reviews are aimed at. Like with all big games and movies and shows the executives who these reviews are aimed at will ignore the reviews and, as they already are, will simply say the game was review bombed and they'll most likely remove all the reviews before a week has passed but all of these reviews are real from real people who care about the game and haven't had a place to band togeather and express their displeasure at how they've been treated until now. And to all the content creators that are saying "all these negative reviews are from people who play all day everday" OF COURSE THEY ARE. THOSES ARE THE PEOPLE WHO WANT THE GAME TO BE GOOD AND WHEN ITS NOT GOOD THE ONLY WAY TO CHANGE THINGS IS TO SPEAK UP. Why would a new person give a negative review after a couple hours, like, do you understand what you are saying. And I'm not even going to get into how every content creator constatly flip flops between posting screen shots of twitch at 4am with more people watching roblox than overwatch and saying the game is dead to posting right when a season comes out about how much content there is and how anyone who says bad stuff about the game is a hater. 8/10 content creators are fake and change their opinion to fit the popular narrative and even attack other content creators for their opinions. Vultures. Vile people and vultures.Anyway. At its core Overwatch is an amazing game and nothing will ever come close but the company running it is the most vile gaming company in existence and their business practices even out do EA (Not forgiving them for Battlefront 2 which they fixed and then cut the servers. Also cut support for anthem.) The only hope for things to get better is the Microsoft acquisition finalizing and Bobby Kotick being pushed out. A lot of people don't like Microsoft for one reason or another but they are FAR more consumer friendly than Activation Blizzard. A final note to any content creator reading this. Grow up. Look in the mirror and realize that you can make decisions for your self and you will still have an audience. From everything the public has ever heard Blizzard aren't nice to you guys either so there's no reason to like their boots and speak out against these reviews like you work for them.Edit: I stand by all that stuff but also HOLY MOLY the game crashes mid game like every hour or two.

Author: ooMIGIToo
Review Content: 1544 hour diamond Zen veteran since day 0. This game use to be a right gem despite all the crummy balancing, toxicity, and lack of heroes. The original team really tried to keep the fans happy and excited, but the slow drip method was just not working. All the feedback provided fell on deaf ears and the game fell to the wayside. This game had a special place in my heart, but after playing season 1 OW2 something didn't feel right. The game just lost its charm and was simply no fun anymore. Why was I playing this? Why were any of us playing this? Was a hope that the game would return to its former glory and become fun to muck around in again? There was always the toxic player base that made competitive pointless in gold and plat, and made those playing in QP feel worthless, driving away newcomers or those just trying to relax after a day of work.OW1 had everything we wanted and more, but OW2 took away the systems and game we loved and turned into a F2P, microtransaction, FOMO, hellscape that we were promised wouldn't happen. Activision really dropped the ball on game that had huge potential.Take it from a vet. Don't waste your time. I wasted too much of mine.

Author: LK335q
Review Content: TLDR: I just want Overwatch 1 back. :( Now I'm going to write a heavily opinionated rambling essay on my grievances with Overwatch while running on fumes late the night before my college semester begins, because for the latter half of my high school years this game was one of the few things I had to look forward to every day. Seeing it in the state it's in now makes me feel as though it's taken a part of me away with it.At the time of writing, the number of hours I've played as listed in-game is 735. For the first years of Overwatch's release, I lived, breathed, and drowned in this game. I don't regret a single second of that. Some of my best teenage memories were spent with Overwatch at the core of it all. I met new friends and grew closer to old friends through it. Overwatch is one of only about four games that have brought me such joy in my life. I loved this game and everything about it.Around Christmas of 2016, I picked it up with a close childhood friend of mine and we played for hours and hours on end, each and every day. I instantly fell in love with Overwatch. The gameplay was fresh and addicting. The characters and the story interested me enough that I would scour YouTube for lore tidbits and every bit of news on the game I could find when I was supposed to be doing schoolwork. I looked forward to hearing papa Jeff tell us all about the awesome new updates that the game received. Between gaming sessions I would listen to coaches like Jayne so that I could learn how to play Overwatch.I wanted to be good at this game.I took pride in maining Sombra. I tried learning as many tips and tricks for her as I could. 16 year old me felt cathartic when someone praised me for my Sombra. For the first time in my life I found something that demanded effort from me while also feeling rewarding.This was Overwatch between the years of 2016 and 2019.Something changed about the game within that time. I can't put an exact date on it, but I'm sure anyone else who shares my experience knows what I mean. The players became more jaded. The sense of fun withered away, some kind of bitter resentment slowly festering in its place. Developers who touted transparency communicated with the players less and less. The grand epic story failed to move forward after years of buildup. The competitive scene slowly overtook every aspect of the game as the Overwatch League became more prevalent, hero balance and map design focusing on esports first and players second. People became alienated from heroes they enjoyed playing because of drastic balance changes, reworks, and meta shifts.Blizzard gearing the game towards competitive pushed away Overwatch's casual players.At the time, it seemed that the game was slowly fizzling away. I found myself losing interest along with many others simply because the game just didn't feel fun anymore. Overwatch became a game you play to win, not a game you play for entertainment. Others may have different reasons to have lost interest in the game, but that was mine. I remember how I felt when Overwatch 2 was leaked. I was a little bit excited. More than anything else, I felt dread. I was afraid of what a sequel would mean for the game that I had adored. In hindsight I find that reaction strange, because on paper it seems like I should have been ecstatic. Overwatch finally had a chance to be saved, if the leaks were true. And come to find out, they were. Overwatch 2's announcement seemed promising. It's the same game but now with a PvE campaign to go alongside it. The perfect chance for Overwatch to redeem itself with its casual playerbase, assuming that nothing goes wrong.The game was revealed, and that was it. For the longest time, nothing. Eventually, Overwatch 2 did release. Seeing that we're all here, I'm sure I don't need to explain the rest.I am beyond disappointed with the direction of this game in the short time since Overwatch 2 released. Somehow, not only were none of the issues I had with the game in the past solved, but they were actually made worse. And to add insult to injury, the one thing that was the entire point of Overwatch 2 in the first place was cancelled. PvE, as it was promised, is not coming. All we get is a cheap, half-baked approximation with a 15 USD price tag slapped onto it as an added ♥♥♥♥-you. In fact, allow me to list every particular grievance I have with this game that I can be bothered to consider at this moment minus the cut PvE content, because I feel the need to put into perspective how this sequel has managed to not only backtrack compared to the original game, but fall into a pit of mud behind it and soil its pants while spontaneously bursting into flames. Overwatch 2 has:- Put a price tag on all original Overwatch 1 cosmetics, which were once available completely free of charge. With the absurd overpricing of cosmetics in this game, Overwatch 1's once-free collection of cosmetics will now run you approximately ~$12,000 if you want to purchase all of it at once.- Broken the promise made in the days of Overwatch 1 that new and old heroes would all be free and fully available to play for everyone, requiring no unlocks.- Removed features compared to the original, including: an entire core game mode from the map rotation, the on-fire feature (though at the time of writing this was re-implemented), profile borders, the card screen at the end of matches, exact SR, and I'm sure there's more that I'm forgetting. - Went out of its way to reduce CC and oppressive abilities from the game, then for reasons beyond me, two of the first new heroes released - Ramattra and Kiriko - have some of the most oppressive abilities in the game.- Fully transitioned from 6v6 to 5v5, which in my opinion is an absolute nightmare. Healing and pocketing is even stronger than it was in OW1, meaning now it's nearly a requirement to kill the healers before anyone else. Tanks are a headache to play in this system - with only one tank per team, hero advantages play such a massive role that you're put at a very heavy disadvantage if you don't mirror or counter the enemy tank.It's just exhausting. I really could keep going, but this review is long enough as is.Overwatch 2 feels like it's too little too late. Too many broken promises, too many compromises, too much greed, and to top it all off the game hardly retains even a sliver of its original spirit. I just can't help but feel like the people at Blizzard forgot what Overwatch was.Overwatch is a hero shooter. It's about HEROES. It was plastered literally everywhere. You log into the game and are greeted with a heroic score and one of many heroes in their iconic pose like they're a Marvel character. The game was full of so much hope and optimism in its tone. In Overwatch 2? The title screen is there to show off the new battle pass theme. The heroes aren't heroes anymore. I mean, Orisa, the protector of Numbani, lost her shield and was given a javelin in place of it. The tone of Overwatch has shifted, and I believe that's because its original spirit was lost.I still think that the characters and the story are kinda cool though. Ramattra is pretty awesome, I like him. The art direction behind the game is as impressive as ever. I'm sure the story isn't that bad either. Some part of me still loves this game. I've had too many memories with it to forget any time soon, but everything that I once played this game for is now gone. Blizzard has announced that another rework of Sombra is coming, and I think that once she's no longer the same, that will be the end of the Overwatch I once loved. After so many years of playing this game, at the time of writing this review, I have uninstalled it from my machine. I don't intend to return soon.I just really miss the time when this game was fun. Thank you Blizzard for creating one of the best games I have ever played, and I hope you are proud of yourselves for what you've done to it.

Author: Shin
Review Content: Aight, Another negative review.I'm a 6 year veteran player in this game. Used to literally study the game to teach people to play it. And I refuse to call it a sequel.Project Titan gave birth to 2 games. Overwatch and Firefall. Both died with bad management. Firefall was a MMOFPS from the start, Overwatch was suposed to be a "beta" for another MMOFPS. Or as they call it, the "walk". But Bobby Kotick Happened somewhere. Mr. Call of Money, CEO of Activision since 1991. And Activision Blizzard since 2008.To be honest, ever since Activision and Blizzard became one, they have released 7 games:StarCraft 2 (2010), Diablo 3 (2012), Hearthstone (2014), Heroes of the Storm (2015), Overwatch (2016), Diablo Immortal (2022) and Diablo 4 (2023)Hope you can see where Kotick started to put his hands on our games.StarCraft 2 had no problems on launch because it was too late in development. But remember Diablo 3 Launch RMTs and bad Servers? Hearthstone is a game that ONLY works with microtransactions, Heroes of the Storm were built after the success of League of Legends, Overwatch, the last original blizzard game, launched with a box price and microtransaction lootboxes. (that looking back now, were not so bad), Diablo Immoral...Look for Josh Strife Heyes video. And Diablo 4 That right now, is being drowned in bad reviews.No game after kotick has been "Blizard Level"Now, after the history recap. To Overwatch Review.Good points?The comunity is passionate.Created a lot of oportunities for smaller streamers to grow.Had the passion of the old team emanating from every single character, map, voice line even the gut down version of the CAMPAIGN.Now for the current bad. And oh boy. There are a lot to be done.First of all. Bobby Kotick still have this game as hostage.The game won't respect your investments. Be it time or money.Balance is only done to "mix the meta up" because designwise, asymetrical characters will never be balanced.Most of the Development team LEFT or were cut from Blizzard. so the "NEW TEAM" are literally learning how to make Overwatch again.The "events" in the game are shadows of the first year of life of the game. About the unpredictable future of Overwatch.This update had everything they had in their pockets after a few seasons without releasing content. The cut down Campaign, the latest new character, new game mode and maps. From now on, Overwatch's Future is a mystery. People who bought and played the campaign, liked the story, but wants more and do not know if we will ever get it. Those who still play the main game, have no fun anymore or are only playing because their friends still playing. BUT with Microsoft now holding the company, who knows. There's hope, but not much.I don't want this game to die, because I've met friends, my wife and they still have fun sometimes with it, The game still have all the potential it had from when it launched... but the way this is heading, hope is running thin."Never accept the world as it appears to be. Always dare to see it for what it could be." - Jeffrey Kaplan

Author: Karicas
Review Content: It is insane how Blizzard lunches good games but then proceeds to ruin every single one over time. What a money hungry company! Advertises Overwatch 2 will have PVE mode, canceles it and expects us then to pay extra 15-40$ for it!

Author: JumboSizedFish
Review Content: Overwatch 2 is a 2022 sequel to the titular 2014 Overwatch, and mate, I have to be honest with you: I made this review for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles to contribute to the blizzard of negative reviews, so I have a hilarious amount of playtime. However, I also made this to make sure you know that this game wasn’t worth my time, and more importantly, neither yours. While I never played the original Overwatch, I heard by its fans that it was a fun and enjoyable game… but then, Blizzard Entertainment, being the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ they forever are, ruined everything!For those unaware, Overwatch got a – quote-unquote “sequel” – with hopes of including an admittedly promising cooperative players vs. enemies campaign, jam-packed with skill trees, randomization, and other good ideas that extends replayability and fleshes out this new mode. But of course, we can’t have nice things, sadly; after hyping up the game with many fans wanting to play together in this PvE gamemode, Blizzard decided to can the mode and many of this features, then double downs with a classic pull of “Blizzcon 2023.”This self-proclaimed sequel will never be worth it, as the main reason why it even exists was pulled away, and considering Blizzard and generally every ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ AAA games company, I doubt that Blizzard wouldn’t even brother making a reasonable substitute. If you are a fan of Overwatch, nothing wrong with that by the way, then I recommend finding something else to play, as Blizzard isn’t worth your time nor money; perhaps consider patching Overwatch to support private servers, since Blizzard since then couldn’t do that.At the end of the day, is Overwatch coming back? Oh, hell no!!P.S. I was actually planning while writing the review to give the game an actual shot, but creating a Battle.net account was and still is a massive plan in the ass. When I finally made it to the human verification, wasting minutes solving twenty math puzzles, the website refreshed and the account was never made. Despite that, that will ever be more fun than this bloody game, and even then, I was getting really pissy on how annoying such puzzles are.

I think it's not worth talking about the fact that they have production hell there. This is a vivid example of the fact that the greed of developers can ruin any game at any time.

Author: Caspppui
Review Content: The Story of Hate and Loveprotagonist #1: over 3000 hours of Playtime on OW1 / OW2 combined Hardcore Fan from the Beginning (2016) Sceptical of many decisions but wanted to give every a fair chance to proof diffrently BattlePass-EnemyOnce upon a time when the games and the monetization were fun, fair and in harmony a greedy king named "Activision" wanted to rule the Gaming world with his greediness and try to empty all the wallets in the world. There was one lord that showed the world he can make great games and treat people fair and with equalness. His name was Blizzard. The world trusted his magicians who created diffrent fantasy worlds full of fun and love. It did not take long, Activision could not satisfy the greed of his secret monster named "Bobby" that was trapped in the upper dungeon of his headquaters swimming in pools of champagne and breastmilk. The people loved and valued Blizzard for the joy he brought to their lifes. It did not take long the monster got too strong. To survive it needed to incorporate more gamer souls and make them suffer as many before them suffered. Blizzard fought strong and defended his lands with honor and glory, but everything was futile. Over the years the moster got too mighty. Blizzard lost the fight and had to give in. But as many legends said: Not all heroes were capes. A close friend of Blizzard who gave his everything to help defend Blizzards lands like it was his own son. Today people still tell stories about that hero named "Jeff". But to protect his family he decided to go a diffrent route. He fought willingly but could not save his friend. That decision might have saved his life legends say. Looking back on the shards of his friend all that was left was his broken heart. That was the last time we heard from him. He might have found a new friend. Meanwhile the monster was still alive. The people got left in the dust with bread crumps for years with no hope in sight.Months went by and the people lost hope more and more. Weekly false promises and worse desicions of balancing their new lands lead to people looking for new jobs. A new experience was praised from the lords but it was all the curtain of the dark money spell. Food was rare, it was a true dark time for many people. But there was this small hope on the horizon. A new maschine and new ways of earning food. A new maschine was delivered but it did not work how it should. The people slowly realized if they just stop buying the overpromised lands maybe the kingdom Activision would fall apart and could get back to his older days. But the monster controlled the lands with his iron claws.5 years later it was a cold season, Activision was desperate. People noticed the might of Activision does not look that bad if you just leave the lands and look for alternatives. Demoralized Activision reached out to some far away monks named "Microsoft" and "Valve" to save his lands from the total downfall. But it was too late. Was the monster defeated? Bad stories were told about Activision in the suggestions box of Valves castle door. Till this day only selected legends will understand the full story.What have we learnd today kids? Yes absolutely correct: Karma will get everbody even monsters and their false kings.Sincerly your brother - Cas -

Author: EarlyZ
Review Content: Ah, Overwatch 2, the game that's been "coming soon" for so long, I started to think it was sponsored by that one friend who's always late to the party. But hey, good things come to those who wait, right? Well, after waiting for centuries, I finally got my hands on Overwatch 2, and let me tell you, it's like they put the "hi" back in "wait."First of all, let's talk about the new heroes. They've got Sojourner, who looks like she's been hitting the gym and the library simultaneously. She's got the kind of biceps that could give Reinhardt a run for his armor. But you know, for someone who's all about knowledge and enlightenment, she sure spends a lot of time hanging out in the battlefield shooting stuff. Maybe her "intellectual conversations only" Zoom call got canceled.And then there's good ol' Junkrat, the explosive jester himself. He's still as lovable as ever, with his wild cackles and knack for turning every fight into a pyrotechnic extravaganza. I swear, if Overwatch was a sitcom, Junkrat would be the wacky neighbor who accidentally blows up his own mailbox every week. But hey, at least he's consistent!Now, let's talk about the maps. Blizzard seems to have taken the "world tour" approach, as we're traveling to all these cool locations like Rome, Rio, and New York. It's like they decided, "Hey, saving the world is great, but have you tried doing it while enjoying some gelato?" I can just imagine the Overwatch team's brainstorming session: "Okay, we've got Paris. Now let's add the Eiffel Tower as a payload. Genius!"And can we talk about the game's title, "Overwatch 2"? It's like they went, "Hey, sequels need numbers, but let's not get too crazy. Just slap a '2' on there and call it a day." It's like naming the second kid in a family "Junior" because you couldn't be bothered to come up with a new name. Classic move.But jokes aside, Overwatch 2 does promise some pretty exciting updates. The story mode looks like a blast, and the new PvP changes have everyone buzzing like a certain electric scientist. So, after all is said and done, I have to admit, Overwatch 2 might have taken its sweet time, but just like a fine wine or a perfectly timed "Nerf this!" explosion, it's worth the wait.Rating: 5/5 exploding piñatas – Unexpectedly explosive, and full of colorful surprises! Author: NeKrowmancer
Review Content: Disappointment is the feeling of dissatisfaction that follows the failure of expectations or hopes[1] to manifest. Similar to regret, it differs in that a person who feels regret focuses primarily on the personal choices that contributed to a poor outcome, while a person feeling disappointment focuses on the outcome itself.[2] It is a source of psychological stress.[3] The study of disappointment—its causes, impact, and the degree to which individual decisions are motivated by a desire to avoid it—is a focus in the field of decision analysis,[2][4] as disappointment is, along with regret, one of two primary emotions involved in decision-making.[5]EtymologyDisappoint is traced to the Middle English disappointen by way of the Old French desapointer. In literal meaning, it is to remove from office.[6] Its use in the sense of general frustration traces to the late 15th century, and it first appears recorded in English as an emotional state of dejection in the middle 18th century.[7]PsychologyDisappointment is a subjective response related to anticipated rewards.[8] Disappointment recovery time depends on the intensity of the disappointment, as well as the person experiencing the disappointment. For some it can take a few minutes while for others the same disappointment can take a few days.Disappointment, and an inability to prepare for it, has also been hypothesized as the source of occasional immune system compromise in optimists.[9] While optimists by and large exhibit better health,[10] they may alternatively exhibit less immunity when under prolonged or uncontrollable stress, a phenomenon which researchers have attributed to the "disappointment effect".[9] The "disappointment effect" posits that optimists do not utilize "emotional cushioning" to prepare for disappointment and hence are less able to deal with it when they experience it.[10][11] This disappointment effect has been challenged since the mid-1990s by researcher Suzanne Segerstrom, who has published, alone and in accord, several articles evaluating its plausibility. Her findings suggest that, rather than being unable to deal with disappointment, optimists are more likely to actively tackle their problems and experience some immunity compromise as a result.[12]In 1994, psychotherapist Ian Craib published the book The Importance of Disappointment, in which he drew on the works of Melanie Klein and Sigmund Freud in advancing the theory that disappointment-avoidant culture—particularly therapy culture—provides false expectations of perfection in life and prevents people from achieving a healthy self-identity.[13] Craib offered as two examples litigious victims of medical mistakes, who once would have accepted accidents as a course of life, and grieving people following the death of a loved one who, he said, are provided a false stage model of recovery that is more designed to comfort bereavement therapists than the bereaved.[14]Lacanians considered childhood disappointment essential to entry into the symbolic world of culture;[15] disappointment in adulthood - the frustration of our demands by the world - as key to discovering who in fact we are.[16]LawWhere goods or services have been purchased in the hope of some enjoyment and the delivery of the goods or services fails to generate the anticipated result, customers have at times sought damages for breach of contract on the grounds of disappointment and distress. Such damages are not generally allowed by the courts, but there are cases where an award for damages has been considered and agreed. English law cases include Jarvis v Swans Tours Ltd (1972) and Farley v Skinner (2001).Milner v Carnival (2010) is another example where customers, in this case Mr and Mrs Milner, who took an extended cruise on the Cunard ship Queen Victoria, had expectations of a benefit which did not materialise and for which damages were sought both for "diminution of value" (the quantifiable difference between the payment made and the value derived) and for "distress and disappointment". Judge Simon Tuckey gave permission for an appeal against the trial ruling on damages, noting that this case "may provide the opportunity to give authoritative guidance on the appropriate measure of damages in 'holiday' cases" where disappointment is an issue.[17]TheoryDisappointment theory, pioneered in the mid-1980s by David E. Bell with further development by Graham Loomes and Robert Sugden,[18] revolves around the notion that people contemplating risks are disappointed when the outcome of the risk is not evaluated as positively as the expected outcome.[19] Disappointment theory has been utilized in examining such diverse decision-making processes as return migration, taxpayer compliance and customer willingness to pay.[20] David Gill and Victoria Prowse have provided experimental evidence that people are disappointment averse when they compete.[21]Disappointed individuals focus on "upward counterfactuals"—alternative outcomes that would have been better than the one actually experienced—to the point that even positive outcomes may result in disappointment.[22] One example, supplied by Bell, concerns a lottery win of $10,000.00, an event which will theoretically be perceived more positively if that amount represents the highest possible win in the lottery than if it represents the lowest.[23] Decision analysts operate on the assumption that individuals will anticipate the potential for disappointment and make decisions that are less likely to lead to the experience of this feeling.[18] Disappointment aversion has been posited as one explanation for the Allais paradox, a problematic response in expected utility theory wherein people prove more likely to choose a certain reward than to risk a greater reward while at the same time being willing to attempt a greater reward with lower probability when both options include some risk.[24]While earlier developers of disappointment theory focused on anticipated outcomes, more recent examinations by Philippe Delquié and Alessandra Cillo of INSEAD have focused on the impact of later disappointment resulting when an actual outcome comes to be regarded negatively based on further development; for example, if a person receives higher than expected gains in the stock market, she may be elated until she discovers a week later that she could have gained much more profit if she had waited a few more days to sell.[18] This experience of disappointment may influence subsequent behavior, and, the analysts state, an incorporation of such variables into disappointment theory may enhance the study of behavioral finance.[18] Disappointment is, along with regret, measured by direct questioning of respondents.[25]See alsoAnticipationParis syndrome

Author: LeKittehOfMeow
Review Content: TLDR: Fun to play casually with friends but its not for the serious FPS enjoyers (comp/ranked)OW2: A hero that live long enough to become the villain of its own storyAs of writing, I have 500+ hours in Battle.net. So whatever x+500 will be my total playtime.Gameplay:The only FPS game that is interesting enough to have role based complexity in terms of having tank/dps/support and each role has its nuances.I main Support(not healer) and I play other games like Apex/COD/Valorant/CSGO. Those games doesn't emphasize or highlight of the role for support as much as OW2. It is sort of like the Dota 2 of FPS. Where tide turning gameplay actually impact the game.Example:- A great suzu that saved everyone from Rein's Shatter- A well timed nano-blade for genjiCompetitive/Ranked:OW1: Shown rank for everyone to see.OW2: Obscured from everyone to see by default unless you turn it on. Games in OW2 is either a coin toss and ranks are often not a indicator of how skilled the individual is. It is frustrating in ranked however playing with friends in quickplay has its charms. Be warned of toxic communication and one sided team fights before you start playing ranked (It will happen)Microtransaction:MTXs are atrocious here. Please play this game without spending any money. We want to reward good games that has the player's satisfaction in mind and not be complacent with bad practices.They even entice OW1 players that OW2 will have a separate PVE mode with its own skill trees.I am a OW2 player so I was not there in the glory days. However it went all downhill from there where the company decided to cancel its PVE separate mode, decided to drip feed PVE missions in chucks of 3 and ONLY ACCESSABLE THROUGH A 15USD purchase.Blizzard will always choose profits over player's fun.I would recommend this game but with a heavy terms and conditions applied - Don't play ranked in hopes that you get a fair game (play quickplay and just chill with friends)- Don't buy any battle passes if you think is not worth it. Blizzard and Bobby Kotick(The House) always win.I like this game however the direction of the game going is breaking my heart. I will play as long as it is still fun for me.

Author: Dog Nerd
Review Content: You could have been a contender...It kind of sucks to have to leave a negative review for a game that I used to love so much, but as someone who has played Overwatch for hundreds of hours across the Xbox One and PC versions, Overwatch has only ever gotten worse thanks to the botched post-launch support. Every time that the Overwatch devs attempted to add new content, it managed to disrupt the enjoyment of the game's sandbox in ways that every kind of player could feel. It made keeping up with Overwatch extremely demoralizing all the way up until the game's final years where content drops slowed to a crawl. Everyone hoped that the followup to Overwatch would fix the game's multitude of unaddressed issues. But, we didn't account for Blizzard's incompetence.Blizzard's consistent trend of decline unfortunately made itself manifest in Overwatch 2, the game that was supposed to breathe life into this floundering franchise. For something that bills itself as a sequel, it is quite literally a downgrade in every conceivable way from Overwatch's initial launch version.They replaced a 40 dollar purchase that guaranteed all of the future content in the game to be unlocked and available with a horrific free 2 play model with all of the terrible features we've sadly become used to: an awful cash shop, new heroes locked behind either paywalls or extremely grindy challenges designed to make you want to skip them with a purchase, and previously advertised content being split up into tiny chunks and sold separately. Much of the promised PvE features including the super cool looking hero skill tree system were outright cancelled as well, cementing this game's marketing and its release as a huge fraud on the Overwatch community. People tend to not forget when you bait people in with exciting features that are coming in the future and then attempt to sweep it under the rug when you decide to scrap it.Buried underneath the messy development history and terrible, exploitative systems is a pretty fun casual shooter with charming characters, a great art style, and gameplay that can occasionally be very entertaining. However, why would anyone want to stick around to experience it when the company running that game has a proven track record of ruining every good thing they've ever made with horrible, heavy-handed balance updates, out of touch communication, and promises that things will improve that are always broken without fail? Most people won't want to, and that's why you shouldn't play this game.

Author: ⛧Marissa⛧
Review Content: I'm not going to get in all the diplomacy of why this game landed on Steam, nor all the shady stuff that Blizzard has done lately. I'm just going to talk about the game itself...It's an FPS that pretends to be played like a MOBA, and thus it's a playground for the most toxic, close-minded community that managed to surpass Dead By Daylight in the sense of hostiity between players, something I didn't think could be achieved.I'm far from the best player at anything, and I haven't played OW in general for 7 years now, but what I've noticed since I started playing is that EVERY. SINGLE. ONE. of the matches I've played end up with one team absolutely dominating the other. This could be a result of really bad matchmaking, and it happens both in casual or ranked matches.It seems that whatever happened in these years gave birth this forced playstyle of two bunch of people dancing back and forth in place, poking each other until someone gets bored, steps out, dies and then their whole team gets decimated as a result. I really don't mind team-play being the optimal way of playing, hell I would even consider it to be the most rewarding kind. But when it's the ONLY viable way of playing the game, it makes for a very broing, forced list of tasks to go through over and over and over, regardless of map, mode or team composition.Having owned the original game, I didn't have to go through the struggle of unlocking all characters, but I can only imagine what a horrible experience that would be. Either that or spend half the cost of a AAA-game on one character... Everything else, cosmetic-wise, is just as overpriced, and the PVE stuff that should've been the selling point for so many people is also, unsurprisingly overpriced for what it offers.The game also seems to be badly optimized, where I keep having frames drops and hiccups every few turns of my mouse, as if the game's struggling to load in all the models and textures while I move around, an issue I've never had with OW1.Overall this game left a very bad taste in my mouth, gave it a try for nostalgia sake and maybe messing around with friends for a few matches, but even as that I've never enjoyed a single minute of what I was offered.

Author: Pyke Ozori
Review Content: I only installed and "played" this on Steam so I could leave a review. Started up the game and literally forgot it was running in the background which is the only reason I have more than 0.1 hours "played".Overwatch 1 was fun and all for a while even though they were constantly re-using their events. Blizzard had an excuse to no longer release proper updates with new heroes, maps, etc. because they claimed they were working hard on Overwatch 2 because it would be mainly focused on PvE which was their priority. Let's fast forward to right now, what did we get? They cancelled the promised PvE mode, yes, now there are PvE missions which will be released in batches of 3 that you will have to pay 15 dollars for every time and won't be anything close to the PvE content they promised. The game is no longer 6v6, they turned it into 5v5, might not sound like a big deal but it really made a difference in gameplay experience. No more lootboxes that you earn by levelling up for ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, sprays, etc. instead there is a shop. The prices for the skins alone, including the ones from Overwatch 1 which people earned for free are 20 dollars, not to mention skins and what not that are locked behind bundles. They even got greedy with their ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Twitch drops which now give you 5 battle pass levels. Overwatch 2 heroes are locked behind the battle pass, you either gotta pay for it, or have to play this game enough to unlock the new hero for the on-going season which is a demonic sacrifice on its own.Are you new to Overwatch 2 and want to play as heroes from Overwatch 1 which everyone got absolutely free? Or maybe you missed out on some heroes from previous seasons? Don't worry, you can buy the Complete Hero Collection for 20 dollars.This game is literally just a worse version of Overwatch 1 with a 2 on the logo, more micro-transactions, a few new heroes and maps, and yes, still the exact same events from Overwatch 1. Junkenstein's Revenge is back of course, not even with a new map. It's exact same map but you get to play in a different area.Do yourself a big favor, save your money, don't give it to Blizzard and play an actual fun game instead of this boring, stale, piece of ♥♥♥♥ god forsaken disaster of a cash grab. Wake up, Blizzard. You guys should be absolutely ashamed of yourselves.If any other devs see this review, take a good look at Overwatch 2. There's no better game in existence to show you how to kill your game.

Author: Pink Diamond
Review Content: Overwatch (1) was my favorite FPS game for a long time, i enjoyed this game so much. But... oh, that's right - this game was stolen from me and replaced with this 5v5, terrible downgrade. This game gives me such a terrible experience, i can't ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ understand how they could take my 40€ and then ruined my game by making it free to play with this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ shop and ugliest skins ever with minimal effort that were put into them and offer them FOR REAL MONEY. Blizzard's monetization is absolute GARBAGE and please, don't ever spend money on this game, even if you somehow enjoy this game, don't let them make money off of you. Author: TheTopDogRob
Review Content: Look Overwatch definitely went down hill the past few years and while i don't hate it i feel ive been lied to about it especially the more recent content that has been added since the launch of Overwatch 2 if you can even call it Overwatch 2, it feels more like an extension if you ask me. Especially since the removed maps like horizon lunar colonies, and Temple of Anubis. As a player who has been playing it since April of 2017 ive seen this game grow and ive seen it fall and for questionable reasons too. The positive thing i can say about Overwatch being ported too steam is that my stuff got carried over my, 3000+ hours ive had on console, and ive gotten all my stuff. Gold weapons, skins, sprays, emotes. It even carried over all of my achievements so i don't have to try and 100% this game again. Thank god for that even if Junkenstein Revenge and Retribution were really fun. The question is do i recommend this game with friends, sure ive had fun moments in the past and still do time to time on this game. However i'm not gonna give this a positive review because of the state the game is in right now. If the game gradually gets better as time goes on i may consider coming back to my review and giving it a positive review. As of right now thumbs down Overwatch. What happened to you?

Author: Eradicati0nn
Review Content: One of the biggest cash-grabs and fumbles in gaming history. Realistically, the signs were there from the first balance patch in 2016.Now, the game only cares about siphoning as much money from your wallet as it can. PvE was cancelled (y'know, the whole reason for the sequel in the first place) and replaced with buyable missions, most of which seem to be around or below the quality of previously free 'story' events.The competitive integrity of the game is a joke. After years of fostering a culture of "you can play whatever you want in comp, you don't even have to try to win", Blizzard now wonders why nobody wants to play competitive. Not to mention of course the massive smurfing issues, which would only be exacerbated by F2P, if anyone still cared enough.Cheaters are rampant and regular, both the well-hidden and the obvious. Every balance change is completely nonsensical and thrown together with no critical thought. Their brand new "hero progression" is also a watered-down restoration of the previous system, which they chose to remove to put the focus on MTX.However, most importantly of all, Blizzard have just ruined the game. It's not fun, it's not challenging, it's just a yawn fest of visual noise and no rewards. I don't think I've ever quite seen a sequel be such a downgrade from a product that was already failing, and the only reason for the sequel is the cash shop. Don't waste your time, TF2 and even Paladins are much, much better.

Author: brantodb01
Review Content: Overwatch was a great game, fun, interesting story hooks, pretty and was pretty good for the first year it was out.The biggest problem was getting your 5 teammates to coordinate in a push and not die in dribs and drabs.Then they started trying to balance the game around the E-sports scene they manufactured. This meant balancing the game around people who were good at overwatch, but most importantly, people who knew how to coordinate. So the issues became even more pronounced and unfun.Overwatch 2 is Overwatch 1 with micro transactions (The cosmetics aren't even good) and a team size of 5 instead of 6. This did improve the game slightly in that it was easier to coordinate however fixed roles and 1 tanks means that most of the "tanks" essentially have no role, as they overlap with DPS and support...but you only have 1 tank so not playing a tank is throwing.Plus the maps are the same, designed and balanced around having 6 players so the maps are too big with significant dead zones, map worse by how it's death ball vs death ball.Overwatch was a great start ruined by bad design over and over again for years until it's a shell of what it should've been

Review Content: Overwatch 2 A fall from heroism Overwatch 2 offers a very unique gameplay experience in contrast to other shooters. Author: Suna
Review Content: Let me take you through my experience of being a fan of Overwatch, and subsequently Overwatch 2:-Overwatch 2 is announced, with a lot of big things coming. Cool!-Limited Overwatch 1 content for several years. I stop playing.-Jeff Caplan leaves Blizzard-The Blizzard allegations occur-Overwatch 2 releases into Beta, announces that PvP will launch first and PvE will come later, so people don't wait too long.-Overwatch 2 launches with most heroes behind a timegate/paywall and an abysmal shop system-Puts new heroes in the battlepass... wtf?-New gameplay and maps are pretty good though-Events are underwhelming, focusing more on MTX than fun gameplay-Baffling balance changes-Announces that PvE is cancelled-Clarifies that only some of PvE is cancelled-Announces that the remains of PvE will be sold for $15 (and it is time-limited)-(A fragment of) PvE releases and it's barely any better than the archives missions in Overwatch 1-Releases onto steam with Overwhelmingly Negative reviews (lol)I was planning on playing more but I can't actually launch the game from steam, so good job.It's clear that the developers are talented and passionate about this game but my god it is very hard to see that through the thick wall of terrible business practices. Blizzard is taking some hard L's lately that's for sure.

Review Content: While the game play of overwatch can be fun, it's over shadowed by the greedy developers that have milked this game of every possible cent they can. Skins that are basic recolors are worth more than they should ever be and unlocking skins passively has become nigh impossible unless you feel like waiting months and months to get only one for free. Overwatch classic was abandoned for three straight years in the promise of this new release. The only reason there's a two next to the title is because the developers promised us an expansive PvE game mode that would have interesting missions and unique skill trees to unlock. Rather than do all that the developers canceled this update, released the 2nd game with barley any changes at all, and profited. Not a single item in this games store or DLC page is worth a cent of your money. The game play is fun but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ greed ruined the experience

Author: yoshi
Review Content: From heroes to zeros, Blizzard's trajectory is a typical short-sighted, greedy, capitalistic fall from grace.It's one thing to evolve a game, but to essentially hijack our initial monetary and time investment by completely removing Overwatch1 and forcing us into Overwatch2 is beyond manipulative, it's a calculated betrayal."Heroes never die" was the rallying cry of a game I once loved. But seeing how OW2 and Blizzard are in their death throes, goes to show they were never the "heroes", they just pretended.Given the trash they've produced, Blizzard, together with its internal garbage they call "execs", should be hung out to dry. They've taken a masterpiece and mutilated it for their petty gains, althewhile abusing their own employees, taking the community for fools and thinking we'll just forget if they give us a few shiny things. Buying this game is like funding the mafia. Behind closed doors they engage in abhorrent behaviour thinking nobody will find out. Joke's on them, the world found out!The legacy of Blizzard's harm, highlighted by the death of Kerri Moynihan at the hands of Blizzard's sexual abuse, is their indelible stain. I hope all those involved in the abuse experience 10 times the pain of Kerri. If they were all lined up to be flogged, I'd buy front row tickets and request an encore.May you burn in hell Blizzard, together with all of your decision makers. You were once great, now you're ♥♥♥♥. Piss off and disappear already.

Author: -=๖CŽﮔ=- ℓιℓ sqυιɗ
Review Content: Well, Overwatch 2 is finally on Steam. Let's look back on what has happened up to this point.✓ Game of the Year 2016.✓ Incredible Cinematics.✓ Amazing diversity of Characters.✓ Solid gameplay with a variety of habilities and ways to play.✓ Spearhead of eSports becoming mainstream with Overwatch League.✓ Stadiums, Merch, events with VAs, special announcements.✓ Incredibly talented artists that make visually impressive content such as skins, maps, even sound.✓ Lootboxes that were pretty generous if the player just plays for a little while per week, easy to get all the new content being released.✓ Over 40M copies sold...X Several grave controversies involving the company.X For a game with a setting about being included and being a hero, they completely blocked people's words and desperation in a time of need for Hong Kong.X Stopped giving constant updates, got lazy.X Very bad patch notes that were unable to break a boring meta that stayed relevant for over an entire year.X Unable to fix several issues that plagued the first game such as toxicity, smurfing, broken strats.X A very good lore, but painfully slow to actually develop and progress to the point where majority doesn't care about it anymore.X Broken promises.X Overwatch 1 was left to rot and suffer a slow death while all their focus were on Overwatch 2 for almost 3 whole years.X Papa Jeff is gone.So, what is Overwatch 2? It's is supposed to be a rebirth, make the game relevant and incredible again. It's nothing more than a fresh coat of paint to Overwatch 1 with a few key differences. PvE, the main advertisement of the game and the "reason" it exists won't ever be released, so all those lost years of suffering a dying game was for nothing.Blizzard now shows their true predatory nature, the game does not respect you. New heroes have to be unlocked on the Battle Pass, the progress is extremely slow, the rewards are often not worth it with the exception of the final tiers. No way to unlock content faster without paying a large amount of money. Toxicity and other issues from 1 are still present.● Game looks incredible and runs very well too, lots of graphical customization.● Gameplay is solid, many different characters and ways to approach a game and situation.● Many QoL features.● It's free.● Requires a battle.net account.● Not many active players, especially on higher tier of competitive.● Increasingly complex the more characters are added, not friendly with new players.I've spent hundreds of hours on OW1 when it came out, and played for plenty of years until 2019. Nowadays considering everything Blizzard has done, it makes me incredibly sad with just how low this franchise reached. All the broken promises, incredibly missing opportunities, bad takes and choices, it saddens for me to say this but it just doesn't deserve to be mainstream anymore. Try the game if you'd like, some of my favorite memories in all of gaming came from Highlights of OW1 but with the direction OW2 is going, I won't be a part of it.

Review Content: It's sad that this company blew such a major part of my life on esports and monetization, at the cost of the players. I've played this game 7 years and it feels like my trust was gained in the first 4 and then exploited in the last 3. Overwatch was genuinely a life saver in high school, but the company decided that money was better than player trust and happiness. I pray this era of live service gaming comes to an end, and companies start making complete products again. I've watched every Blizzard series die at this point and it feels like they took Bungie with them. I feel ashamed to have once been called a fan of Activsion Blizzard.

Author: Fel
Review Content: Don't let the "Blizzard Entertainment, Inc." developer & publisher fool you. The Blizzard people loved for so long has been dead for years. It is a corpse puppet Activision uses for marketing purposes, that is all.Overwatch 1 wasn't a perfect game, not by a long shot. But Overwatch 2 is a worse version of Overwatch 1 in every single way. Lets see what bad design choices fall onto the tracks as my train of thought gets rolling...I will preface this with the fact that if they didn't take Overwatch 1 away from everyone that bought it I wouldn't give a ♥♥♥♥ that they released a inferior Free2Play sequel, I would just go play that.5v5 sucks horsecock, I don't give a ♥♥♥♥ what streamers, pros, or the devs say. The majority of players are not pros, if the balance of Overwatch 2 built around such a small segment of the community its no wonder people are quitting the game. Its not like 6v6 was ever perfectly balanced, but I think that it allowed for a bit more freedom when it came to counter-picking. I know that counter-picking is big part of the game and always has been, but 5v5 has made it almost impossible to have fun in the game without selecting meta characters/hard counters (this is doubly true for tanks).6v6 enabled soft-countering, which made it possible for people to play characters they enjoy. It allowed people to pick someone they wanted to play that could contribute to dealing with a particular threat without putting it all on their shoulders. It meant that success or failure in a fight wasn't down to just 1 player death on 1 team deciding who wins that engagement. Also many of the tanks in Overwatch were never built with solo tanking in mind and without complete reworks never can.I know some will say 5v5 was done to solve shield meta. But how ♥♥♥♥ is changing the game to 5v5 and then trying to re-balance everything off that easier than just re-balancing some shield users or their counters?5v5 is why Open Queue and Mystery Heroes are the only main modes its possible to have some fun in.Push sucks horseballs. Assault had its issues, but push just feels like you are going nowhere fast escorting a idiotic robot back and forth(What the ♥♥♥♥ is it pushing? A tall jersey barrier?). Its entirely possible the whole match will take place in quarter of the map as both teams just trade the bot and it goes barely farther one way than the other. You don't feel like anything was accomplished. But its probably a good thing cause the map design is just a lazy mirrored layout. At least with Assault you could change tactics and lineup based on location. And sure some games were steamrolls on attack or defense, but at least it was quick. Charging for early access to characters is pay to win. Just because they can EVENTUALLY be earned doesn't mean they aren't pay to win. And just because other games do it doesn't mean its acceptable. Its a scumbag move no matter who does it. Overwatch 2 coulda earned a couple positive points on the ♥♥♥♥ meter if they didn't do it.What can I say that hasn't already been said about the overpriced cosmetics? Well I could say how they converted Overwatch 1 players' in-game currency into the least valuable type of 3 currencies in Overwatch 2. And how the legendary skins of Overwatch 1 became only available for the 2nd most valuable currency of Overwatch 2. Essentially anyone who hadn't already spent their Overwatch 1 currency had it turned from "real" money into monopoly money as far as the game was concerned. But I guess if Activision is willing to steal the game we paid for from us, it is willing to steal our time and money also. They did end up changing this so the old skins were obtainable with that monopoly money, but it doesn't change the fact that they tried to do it. And the new "gold" currency is such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ grind to obtain its not even worth trying to get it. Author: Ever
Review Content: My love letter to the REAL Blizzard Entertainment:The first time i played a Blizzard game i was enamored by the worlds they created, and the bars they raised when it came to quality.It was truly a gift and a privilege to be a part of the golden years of this company and community.The day "Overwatch" came into beta and beyond (not Overwatch 2) was truly the best days of gaming memories in my lifeI have nothing but love for the people who work tirelessly hard on these games and that's why it breaks my heart to see the path its taken.There are still great talented people at Blizzard who are working hard this very moment to bring us the best they can bring us with the tools they have available.I think that's just the thing though, i think there is a handful of people who truly care about the product left and pump original great ideas into these games.NONE OF THOSE PEOPLE HAVE POWER AND SAYnot unless they want to lose their livelihood...And when they try and manifest everything they know Overwatch can be or could have been they are shut down by their higher ups before it even takes its first breath.this is evident in the way they release updates and the way they handled PVE.i cant help but notice the shame in the people who are still left and passionate, and it hurts me profoundly.i love this community and i love this game but you people who sit in your ivory towers of steel with no regard for1.) the people you hurt2.) the franchises you kill3.) the employees who made youYou sell lies and hope, you profit off of suffering by your most loyal members of your community and company.You masquerade as "Blizzard" a company who was competent and caring for its loyal fans.WE know the truth. you are not "Blizzard" you aren't even "Activision". You are something far far worse...Some frankenstein abomonation of a Fortnite apex wannabe when we knew you were something so much more then that.You were THE game for me and many others and ill always hold a spot in my heart for this franchise and its community.all the friends i have met all the memories created and all the time shared with great people in competitive spirit who just wanted to be the best they could be.If you were one of those people, i see you i hear you and i'm glad you are still here but i wont lie our odds are slim.slimmer now more than ever.. and that's saying somethingIF YOU ARE READING THISwhether you were toxic and would say ggez or the good sport who always took it on the chin and said gg no matter the outcome.whether you were the bronze baddie or the grandmaster god who couldn't be touched.whether you were here for a week or for a long 6-7 years of highs and lows "blizzard" put us through.Thank you.Thank you for being there and being a part of this community and playing a part in creating memories for something that felt truly special for me and many others.TO THE PEOPLE RUNNING THIS SHOWYou are hated and you are loathed and no words i can put here can truly encompass the amount you deserve to be vilified,from the way you treat employees to the way you treat your own IP's.I truly cant imagine how soulless and greedy you are, devoid of life like some sort of freakish stump u feed money to just to barely keep alive when u cant help but question."is that even a life worth living?"How you can concern yourself not with product and solely with profit margins and think there is no correlation is INSANITY.You businessmen who think like that have no place in the gaming industry we hate you and we would be glad if you all got Thanos snapped out of existence.You kill creativity and livelihoods all for the sake of your selfish desires and pursuits while having no understanding for the medium you reside.I guess "that's the way the world is" "but i do miss the old days". </3TO THOSE LEFT AT BLIZZARD WITH PASSIONThank you most of all, You have suffered the most.You have been caught in the middle between corporate and consumer,and whatever crunches you had to do and whatever holidays you missed with family's.I'm sorry and thank you so much, you do not go unnoticed and you are the real reason i am still here and even willing to waste my time typing this.thanks to all the members who have left as well no secret who they were, legends in our community.I wish you guys the best truly we love ya and we will never forget you or your beloved creation we know this isn't what u had in mind.I doubt anyone reads this far but i just had to let it all out I've been here for what feels like forever and thanks for reading it <3A wise man once told usNever accept the world as it appears to be, dare to see it for what it could be.You will always be with me Overwatch, my friends and foes, and the loving creators who made the good possible.                                                                            INITIATE                                                               OVERWATCH RECALL ?                                                                             Y    N

Author: Petersky
Review Content: OW2 on Steam? Disgusting, blatant cash grab.After neglecting (initially really fun game, promising to be the next great brand) the original OW to death and forcing players to switch to OW2 (yes, it is not possible to play original anymore) everything went downhill.Oh, and just to remind and highlight the fact: the original OW was a full-price game; after enjoying it with my family and friends since 2016 all we got in OW was some lousy badges and an access to one new character.Anticipated story mode? Straight to the bin, there wasn't even an attempt to implement it."Free to play" model? That's just an excuse to rake in skins and other cosmetics money from not-knowing-any-better players (previously, obtainable for free - loot boxes mechanics might have been a tiresome, random grind, but hey - those are just cosmetics, in the end).New characters introduced periodically? Well, that is one thing they kept to, but still - they put a paywall in front of it (battle pass, season pass or whatever they call it).In conclusion: after hundreds of enjoyable hours spent in the original OW, but with OW2 I am just disappointed in how they treated the player base and the game itself. That is all.

Author: Aziz-Alrafaei
Review Content: My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Author: Falcon
Review Content: Blizzard's decision to lock Overwatch story missions behind a paywall is nothing short of a slap in the face to its loyal fanbase. It's a brazen move that reeks of corporate greed, showing a total disregard for the gamers who have supported the franchise since its inception.Let's start by recalling the initial promise. Overwatch-1 was a paid title. Gamers spent their hard-earned money, investing not just financially but emotionally in a game that, while primarily a competitive shooter, tantalized with a rich backstory and a world filled with lore. The prospect of Overwatch-2 offering PVE story missions was a shimmering beacon of hope for many. It was a chance for fans to delve deeper into the world they had grown to love, to connect with the characters on a level that went beyond just the competitive arena.However, what transpired was a series of broken promises and missed opportunities. After years of teasing Overwatch 2, the company decided to cancel it altogether. It's a move that left many feeling betrayed. Gamers had committed countless hours, bolstering the community, creating content, and sharing their passion for the Overwatch universe, only to be left high and dry.And now, the audacity to reintroduce story missions, but at a staggering $15 for just three missions? It's a move that feels more like a cynical cash grab than a genuine effort to provide content. For context, many AAA titles with intricate stories, hours of gameplay, and cutting-edge graphics are available at prices that make Blizzard's offering look like daylight robbery.Overwatch's allure was never just about the gameplay. It was about the world, the characters, and the stories that tied them all together. It was about the emotional investment players made into this universe. But with this latest move, it's evident that Blizzard views its players not as fans, but as mere dollar signs.Comparing it to other games, the value proposition is laughable. But even more than that, it's a sad reflection of how far Blizzard has strayed from its once-storied reputation of being a company that prioritized its fans. Today, it seems they are more interested in short-term financial gains than in nurturing the community that made them a gaming giant.In conclusion, locking the Overwatch story missions behind such an exorbitant paywall is not just bad business—it's a stark betrayal of trust. Gamers deserve better, and Blizzard should know better.A BIG FAT ♥♥♥♥ YOU BLIZZARD! is all i have to say . NOT RECOMMENDED.

Author: Bathius
Review Content: I've had Overwatch 1 through 2  when it first came out and 1 was great (loot boxes feel way better than a SCAM OF A BATTLE PASS). My final conclusion is that blizzard has the same mindset as someone who thought the American School System was a great idea today. An example of their stupidity is from today where I was playing the game because of the new character and I see it as my favorite support so far. I was also surprised that the character was FREE finally; which makes sense for a game where meta matters (I mean, every other fighting games has the same problem; but that's besides the point). BUT...but but but...the servers all of the sudden did an "update" where she's only available where YOU HAVE TO BUY HER IF YOU DON'T WANNA PLAY 50+ GAMES. That'll takes way to long; AND IMAGINE FOR THE OTHER CHARACTERS WHEN THEY WERE ON THE BATTLEPASS. IMAGINE GOING THROUGH THESE CHARACTERS ONE BY ONE THROUGH BATTLEPASS OR EVEN THE CHALLENGES. When i was looking at lifeweaver. It wanted me to play 35 games of open queue which is completely stupid. If i want to  play the characters I have to do those 200+ matches of games quite possibly or buy them. BUYING THEM IS MORE EXPENSIVE THAN ANY OTHER FIGHTING GAME CHARACTER. Fighting game DLC is usually like 5 bucks per a character or 20 bucks for a whole season of characters which isn't much. BUT THIS GAME; IT'S 10 DOLLARS PER A CHARACTER ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. YOU CAN'T MAKE THIS STUFF UP! YOU'RE SPENDING 50 + (15 FOR THE BATTLEPASS) DOLLARS TO PLAY THE CHARACTERS THIS IS ONLY FOR A 6 CHARACTERS VS A SEASON PASS THAT'LL COST YOU 20 BUCKS FOR 6 OR MORE. GUESS WHAT; FIGHTING GAMES ALSO PROVIDE FREE CONTENT SUCH AS PVE WITHOUT MAKING YOU SPEND MORE THAN WHAT YOU'VE PURCHASED OR EVEN A FREE FIGHTING GAME. While that's one problem of the game; there's another, being a big fat liar. THEY'VE PROMISED SO MUCH BUT NEVER DELIVERED A SINGLE TIME IN THEIR LIFE. PVE, CUT EVERYTHING THAT WAS PROMISED, LOCKING HEROES WHEN THEY SAID THEY WON'T, AND MANY MORE THAT I DON'T WANT TO FIND AND BE SAD ABOUT. I don't know how you fail a game harder than any other game I've ever seen. How the hell does Paladins have a better hero unlocking system than OW2. TEAM FORTRESS 2 HAS LESS SUPPORT BUT A BETTER FREE TO PLAY SYSTEM THEN ANY OTHER GAME I'VE EVER SEEN. Illari was literally my favorite hero in the support role and I can't play her without banging my head against the wall 50 times. ♥♥♥♥ you blizzard and I hope you go bankrupt.
