Author: H30000
Review Content: TL:DR: Don't try this game, just don't. Stay as far way from it as possible, it is for your own well being. Now, where do I even begin? Overwatch (2) is one of those games where every 5th review is a person with 6000 hours saying: "I hate this game, and it makes me hate evreyone. 10/10" and that is very true. There is nothing like overwatch, but it is still awful in so many regards. Overwatch(2)' gameplay is something truly special, and while many will disagree: you cannot replicate a game like this, blizzard has caught lightning in a bottle. No matter how many losing streaks filled with horrible matches you have, you will be coming back for more. The joy this game brings is inexplainable.  However...  Blizzard's handling of what was once a game of the year winner has left it being a shell of its fromer self.To begin with the elephant in the room: Overwatch 2 is not a sequel, especially not anymore. Overwatch 2 was supposed to be blizzard's big splash into PvE for this franchise. Overwatch 1 was left with basically no new content after the release of 'Echo' in 2020 with the promise of PvE. Overwatch 2 releases early in October of last year with all the map and hero content the last years were missing, and no PvE. What it did have though, you guessed it a cash shop. Blizzard took away overwatch 1's progression system which allowed for the acquisition of almost all cosmetics for free, given enough time, with the launch of overwatch 2. In its place the game got a battle pass and $20 skins. One skin, for one character (of which there are more than 20)  for 20 dollars USD . In May of this year blizzard announced that PvE (as they advertised it) would no longer ship due to it being too big a undertaking (translation = it wouldn't generate enough money for the company). The game got no major content for two years under the promise of a big release with the sequel, just for the "sequel" to strip players of all free progression and then cancelling the promised PvE anyways. Overwatch (2) removed  more features than it added and some are still being added back by blizzard. Lol. Don't get me started on the disaster that is blizzard's handling of the esports scene.On to the actual playing experience: Awful. Blizzard constantly adds power creep with every new character they release (which is initially locked behind the battle pass by the way). They heavily favour certain characters, while others have been bottom tier for several years. The game has no sense of direction when it comes to balance, and blizzard does not know what to do with certain heroes. This would be fine if blizzard didn't take  several months  to release new patches to fix the mess they created. Characters like Lifeweaver and Sym will probably never see the meta. While charcters like Mercy, Kiriko, Ana and Sombra (just to name a few) will always be proplematic due to the extreme difficulty of balancing around certain parts of their kit. Word of advice: never ask a doomfist main how they feel about the character, or how many bugs he has (some from release).Other than that: Matchmaking is horrible even in the highest ranks simply due to the nature of how the game is structured with it's heroes. And solo queue is an absolute slog in the most casual of modes. This game will leave you fuming at the sheer lack of awareness many people exhibit. In casual modes you will be at a minor to severe disadvantage 50% of the time when queuing into a game, because players who get defence are at such a big advantage.Oh and screw push, the chane of that horrible game-mode appearing single handedly keeps me from doing "one more game". Can it be fun? Absolutely, especially with friends. Is there anything else like it on the market? Absolutely, not. Is what blizzard has done, and is doing to this game not at all the way to go? Should you honestly pick this up as a first time player? No. Will I still play this and have fun even if not for long periods like pre-OW2? Yes, probably.

Author: favela_fan
Review Content: overwatch 2 had me curious do to it's now infamous negative reviews here on steam, so i gave it a try.first off i needed to link my steam account up with battlenet but no need to download a separate launcher, which is a thumbs up from me.the games  tutorial is pretty boring but you have complete it to continue, afterwards you have to play its practice range, i do not know or understand why they are separated since it's the same thing but its whatever, one more thing about the tutorial, the voice for it is putting me to sleep.alright on to the gameplayi played 10 games in the no roles quick match i got to play mostly as healers since my teammates didn't want the game lacks things i find common in other class based games Unlimited ammo so no need to find ammo pickupsthis with the fact most reloads are quick turn many gun fights into spam hell my time in the game have been lonely do to my mic being muted so even when other people talked i could join inand as a healer where you need to play off teamm8s made the experience feel off like playing cs go with out hearing footstepsin my final conclusion i do not understand the hate for such a mediocre game but listening to the older play had given me an idea a game that was special to many people got turned into a wannabe competitive e sports and then into a free2play item game in its current state i would not recommend

Author: Latte
Review Content: The game itself is great, well polished, the gamemodes are decent, the heroes are fun, the music is nice the visuals and animations are stellar, there's obviously a lot of care put into the game on a development and optimisation level... It's just that the executive lies and deceiving from the games past is impossible to overlook and Blizzard has completely sabotaged everything likeable about the experience from an ethical standpoint. I do love the game for what it is, a very well made ability-based team-shooter, however I think that the community is rightfully upset about how their expectations have been set so high and then been let down by false promises, corporate greed, and lack of communication up to now. I also genuinely hope that things change in the future, and I have seen the recent strides taken from the developers to do so. I genuinely love playing Overwatch and have done so since the beginning of Overwatch 1 so it's slightly painful to not recommend the game for me, that being said: until the management of the game is overturned or sees significant changes I doubt the review bombing will ever really let up.

Author: ⛧glıtch
Review Content: >Be Activision-Blizzard>Try to make the "Team Fortress 2 Killer">Advertise the Title>People are hyped af>Release Overwatch in 2016>Abandon the game after 5 competitive seasons>Become a Chinese slave>People leave the game>Do nothing until late 2021>Sell out majority of your competitive scene to the Chinese>Hype player base for the "big changes" and PvE content>Instead of make proper balance changes cut the flexibility and content from the game>China bans every single one of your titles>Delay the PvE update until q2 2023>Abandon PvE idea>People get mad and force the idea back>Release 3 missions for $15>People get mad even more>Act like nothing happened and relase the title on Steam - the literal home of your competitor Yeah guys, don't even try to understand their thought process. They deserve every single negative comment coming towards them. No wonder the pⲟrn content with cracked models from that very title is more popular than the game itself.

Review Content: It uses auto mutes and auto banns.Which means if enough players report you you be muted or banned automatically.It all comes down to how many reports you have, not about if the report was legit or not.Counting up from 24 hours and every time you get muted or banned it doubles by 2.Again, even if you got banned or muted for nothing and they overthrow it.You still be banned for 48 96 192 etc hours every time you reach a report threshold.Blizzard doesn't care about you, make sure you note this one down.Even if you got banned or muted for no reason, prob they won't overthrow it anyway.So if you don't play the meta roles, don't be suprised you getting muted and or banned out of nowhere.

Review Content: Not the game i remember playing, they murdered the game we all once loved and put this cashgrab instead.Where is the PvE mode promised, oh yeah it got cancelled, so basically this is worse that Overwatch 1 with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ battle pass system, heroes hid behind paywall or grind, skins are only available for those who has deep pockets. Oh right, you have one passionate about game anymore.Also Aaron Keller, if you want this "review bombing" to stop - I am only writing a review to share my opinion - you could have delivered your promises, keeping the original "all heroes are free" design and keeping level system with loot box ( I got it, it is gambling for some and you had problems with some countries and their laws, simply remove purchase option for loot boxes and add battlepass as well) this way you could make money with battle pass and people who won't spend a dime on this game still could get cool skins and stuff.I also missed Hanamura and Volskaya as well, you could just remove it from ranked rotation and keep them in quick play map pool.Pros:- Free to Play- ???Cons:- Heroes behind pay wall- 20 dollars for skins- Push Mode- No 6v6- Battle Pass- Paid PvE content (15 bucks for 2 hours worth of content)- Releasing too many heroes which will cause an unbalanceable game- No access to the game I paid for (Overwatch 1)

Author: Assass1n1191
Review Content: I have over 800 hours in Battle.Net.Since I first played Overwatch 1 I loved this game. Game's universe, characters, mechanics, map design - I loved it. We played with friend since 2018 and had tons of fun. Even when game stopped to receive updates we continued playing, because we genuinly loved it.When Overwatch 2 was announced I was SO excited, i couldn't wait for beta to start. Then beta was released. It was buggy, raw and with lack of content, but ok, I waited for full release with hopes that it will get better. And then on October 4 Owerwatch 2 was released. Same lack of content, more than a half mechanics removed compared to OW1, added skins for 20$, insane amount of grind required to get a legendary skin (a few months for a single skin), battle pass which gives 0 excitement to complete it, but still I played it for the first 4 seasons.But then I left, I can't stand it anymore. Matchmaking is SO bad, low rank players playing with high rank, also new events are pointless and no excitement to play them at all. But you know what is the worst? The attitude for players. They cancelled PvE, they put insane prices and grind limits just for one reason - money.I don't like when game developers theat players like that and I wish nobody to be treated like that. So my review is a warning to don't start playing this game, developers don't care about anything but money, they don't deserve that loyal playerbase they had.I wish for Overwatch 2 online to be 0 - that what Blizzard deserve. They need to understand that their desicions have consequences.

Author: Kiyoshi
Review Content: I have spent over 9 000 hours playing Blizzard games—out of that at least a thousand in Overwatch and its reboot. Those games used to be my home, my refuge. Yet today, I deleted my Battle.net account. Given the increasingly predatory nature of Overwatch, Diablo, World of Warcraft and HearthStone, it was not simply the right thing to do—it was the only thing to do. Supporting Activision Blizzard in any way contradicts basic human morality. Even worse, experiencing something positive in those games is becoming close to impossible. And so, one trades their morality for misery.I hope many more will relinquish their shackles imposed by this corporate.

Author: KiKO
Review Content: Not a day one player, nor closed beta but I've been playing it actively since the first anniversary event (2017) until late 2020 where I switched to Apex Legends. Honestly? Best switch I've made, game feels more rewarding to me and more fun despite its flaws. I have around 1k hours on OW. Apex nearing 3k now. My Overwatch backgroundThis is the game that introduced me to online FPS world and made me hooked on the genre. There are so many heroes and mechanics catered to everyone's level of entry, experience, and prefered role. My first main or character I picked up being D.Va because Neon Genesis Evangelion. I stayed mostly on the (off) tank role since then, too. I survived the GOATS meta (tbf I didn't bother with ranked there) and the content drought. I came back for new events and weekly arcade lootboxes just to close the game again. That interest eventually died too after the Halloween event. I became so burnt out on the game and its technically non-existent balancing. Rank-wise I played it rather casually around Platinum level.Overwatch "2" (or 1.1)Now, OW2 was on the horizon. They released it early, keeping us warm on the promised PvE (THE WHOLE JUSTIFICATION OF CALLING IT A SEQUEL AND PUTTING A "2" BEHIND THE NAME). I tried it out, it was ok! I had fun playing it casually with friends and adjusting to the 5v5 mechanics and gameplay. It did feel better than the double shield stuff. S1, I purchased and finished the BP in the end. Didn't get much out of competitive (though the system of grinding and displaying ranks was really annoying at the time). It was alright but it also didn't hook me back as it did. Apex had me by my balls witih a firm grip.S2, Ramattra comes out. Darn, it's my first locked hero and it's a tank. Caved in and purchased the BP again because of the very slow XP progression at the time. Didn't regret it because I love this character but I haven't had the time to finish the BP so it felt like 10 bucks down the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ overall. Didn't bother with the game S3-S5. Lifeweaver was lackluster, I tried him out. He felt very underwhelming to say the least. The game itself wasn't rewarding for me to play.Then they dropped the bomb during the Starwatch stream or whatsoever. Basically 45 minutes of filler content about the current event I didn't bother with, just to then drop the bomb. They are cancelling the PvE (and they knew it way before but didn't know when to drop the bomb). Or at least cancel it how they wanted to sell it to us at BlizzCon 2019 with a watered down version of it. So basically they're bringing Archives events (that used to be released for free in OW1) and want us to pay 15 bucks if we wanna play it?? Honestly this is so shameless. The whole monetization of this game has been a disaster. OW2 is just a huge shop update with predatory microtransactions. I can't even comprehend how you can release something so bad that people prefered the old lootboxes system over whatever this is. A cashgrab. And it seems to work. Who tf buys that?The skins are bangers, no doubt. Blizzard's art team is carrying this dead horse of a game so hard. I don't think they're reasonably priced though. Same with the story missions. I'd rather put those 15 bucks elsewhere and just watch the cutscenes on YouTube which I did.And it all makes me so mad because I really enjoy the lore and world-building. The Genesis triology slapped and it got me so mad, thinking of this game's wasted potential over the years. The new hero (Illari) looks fun and strong though. tl;dr I'd rather pay full price 60-80 USD for the promised PvE and come back to the PvP casually than whatever the hell they made out of this game. Playing Blizzard games is like being in an abusive relationship at this point. Promises to change but never does and becomes something worse that you could ever imagine. Yet you still wanna give her another chance because of that first spark that hooked you.

Author: Froggy B
Review Content: To quote Aurelio Voltaire in The Necropolis of Former Lovers:  "You finally made me mad enough to write that song about you."Consider this review a swan song. Initially I wasn't going to join in on the negative review train, but then Aaron Keller had to open his mouth and act like the foolish corporate puppet he is.Hey, Aaron? If getting review-bombed is not a good experience, maybe consider that your game is not a good experience to play.TL;DR version: Overwatch 2 is not a game worth your time or money. Overwatch 2 is a testament to executive abuse, out of touch developers, corporate greed, and a playerbase that is held in a Stockholm Syndrome-esque addictive bondage. Do not play it, do NOT spend money on it. The only thing Actiblizz understands is money, and until that money stops flowing, they do not care about the sheer volume of negative press they get.Let me get these facts stated first, for the shills who will scream "REVIEW BOMBER:"-I admit to inflating my Steam playtime by letting the game idle, to make it harder to filter out. HOWEVER, I had over 1400 previous hours through the Blizz client, from January 2018 - February 2023, so I think I am allowed a little "fibbing" to ensure my voice is heard.-I am not a "disgruntled" TF2 or Paladins player. If I'm going to point you to any multiplayer game, it's Don't Starve Together.-I officially quit in February 2023, shortly before the Valentine's Day/Cupid Hanzo event, and kept up with the major events through news/social outlets. I did in fact play through the "maintenance mode" years of OW1 as well as the first two seasons of OW2 as well as part of Season 3, until my disgust became insurmountable. So I am not one of those "hasn't played the game since 2018" people.With that out of the way, let's talk about why this game *is* so bad as to warrant over 100,000 negative reviews, shall we?The deletion of the original game.When Overwatch 2 was first announced (back when Jeff Kaplan was still the lead director), it was said that Overwatch 1 would still exist in a sort of "stasis state." Players could still play the game they paid for, and would receive PvP updates (maps, characters, etc.), but the "full experience" which was the PvE material and all things related would have to be paid for. Instead, the devs removed OW1 outright and forced OW2 down everyone's throats.The monetization.This is the biggest and most justified complaint that most people have. OW1 was a "buy to play" game with cosmetics-only lootboxes, which could also be bought *or* earned for free through gameplay. While lootboxes have their own problems, the fact that they and almost all save a scant few cosmetics could be earned for free alleviated the gambling issue by a large margin. (This is something you cannot even say about TF2, which requires you to buy keys and the like in order to unlock their loot crates.) All other content was free as well - heroes, maps, and even event modes like Archives were available to all players without having to shell out a single extra penny.This was then replaced by one of the WORST F2P, FOMO-laden models I have ever seen. The bias towards whales vs. non-paying players. Battlepasses that need to be paid for, heroes that are locked behind said battlepasses making the game a pay-to-win/P2W scenario, cosmetics being timegated (before you could get them again when an event rolled back around the next year, and usually cheaper too), various event missions (such as the watered-down PvE) are also locked behind a paywall. Completing the battlepass doesn't even give you enough currency to buy the next one, something even FORTNITE, the originator of most terrible F2P cosmetic practices, does for you.The feature downgrade.Where do I even begin. First of all is the PvE, which was the whole reason that Overwatch 2's existence was justified in the first place. PvE was scrapped entirely, worse was that they *knew* they had scrapped it and intended to focus on their "live service"/"battlepass" model for well over a year before announcing it, so as to keep milking money from players who were holding out in the interim. What was left of the PvE was basically stripped for parts then served back to the playerbase for even more money. Then there was the removal of a tank, removal of most social features like Looking For Group, end of match cards, the on-fire system, the removal of several characters' core movesets as they got reworked yet AGAIN for the worse (I wasn't even a Doomfist main, but man he was done dirty), the removal and now somehow RETURN BUT WORSE version of the leveling system, the deterioration of the matchmaking quality - prioritizing quick queues over quality and causing the likes of Bronze and Grandmaster players to be dumped in the same matches as each other. Even the graphics are a downgrade, the entire lighting system is completely scuffed, the skins are lackluster and clearly outsourced, and the map redesigns have some cover lazily slapped on without any actual effort put into fixing them for new formats. They even brought back MAP POOLS despite them trying that in OW1 and it being widely hated!The story and characters.This one is a personal gripe, I'll admit, since the only people who cared about the lore of Overwatch were me, my friend, and one insufferable guy on Reddit (Doc, you know who you are). Say what you will about the quality of Overwatch's story, at least it and the characters were consistent. Now? We've thrown out all the original plot hooks for "Omnic Crisis 2.0." Which REALLY does not look good considering that the main villain spearheading it is from an oppressed class. It wasn't good when David Cage did the robot uprising as a metaphor for racial tension in Detroit Become Human, it's not good when Actiblizz does it either. We've gone against established worldbuilding for the sake of aesthetics - Michael Chu was not the best writer, but at least Chu was consistent. Magic was NOT a thing in Overwatch, not even for the Shimada dragons, which was some form of technology not yet explained/explored. But oh, we bring in the manic snarker magic fox girl Kiriko because we want the h0rny weeb money. There's also the extreme flanderization or utter non-development of characters. Sojourn is STILL boring, Soldier 76 has turned into a walking boomer joke, Pharah finally got a personality and it's "bootlicker jock", while they turned my sweet babygirl Orisa into a violent juggernaut. These are not the characters I loved, these are not the characters I read in their original stories and comics. These are caricatures, made to appeal to kiddies who wanna buy skins and look cool.The diversity as a smokescreen.I could literally track Actiblizz controversies with their announcements of "diversity" events and characters, as well as the fact that it's little more than lip service considering that they make content censorable so that they can still profit off bigoted foreign markets (such as Tracer's girlfriend reveal). Example: Pharah and Baptiste revealed as LGBT characters? Right before the PvE cancellation is announced. The Hong Kong incident. The sexual harassment scandal that led to McCree's renaming. The fact that it TOOK SO MANY YEARS for there to even BE a Pride Month event. The many female players that are chronically harassed while Blizz shills a pro-female stream event. It's all disingenuous.The original Overwatch got the praise it did for a reason. It had great potential and it was run by devs who clearly actually cared and were passionate about what they were doing outside of profit. The game still had problems, sure, but it was fun to play despite those problems, the playerbase loved it, and at most the game needed a little upkeep or management to iron its problems out.Instead, that original team quit and we got Overwatch 2, the hollow parasite puppeting around its predecessor's corpse.

Author: MayaMomo
Review Content: Alright, I wasn't going to do this originally, but decided why not. As you can see from my achievements, I played this game a lot. I turned it on through steam basically solely to give my review for Overwatch 2, I'd personally prefer to review Overwatch 1 as that's the game I played since 2016, but they killed it and replaced it with a shell of what it once was, so I guess I'll be reviewing Overwatch 2 and giving a sort of post-mortem review of Overwatch 1. Where to begin...I like many, many others, played Overwatch on release day in 2016. I absolutely loved it. Became a D.VA main for a good few years and enjoyed almost all of my time in the game. I paid 40 euro for the game, and can say I never once paid for a lootbox cosmetic. Why is that? Well, back in the day, before this hellscape of battlepasses, drip fed content and 30$ skins, we had lootboxes. They weren't great, in fact they sucked. I wrote a thesis in 2019 about lootboxes and how they correlate with the rise of problem gamblers in people aged 18-30 in the late 2010s, so I know a bit about this system and can safely say its not great. You know ActivisionBlizzard royally ♥♥♥♥♥ up when they make people wish the had lootboxes back....For all the faults of lootboxes of which there are many, you could still earn quite a lot of them in Overwatch 1 simply by playing the game, without spending a penny and certainly not no-lifeing the game I managed to get almost every cosmetic for most characters. Overwatch 2 is basically an excuse to revamp the cash shop, in the wake of government intervention against gambling mechanics in videogames, ActivBlizz decided it wise to move away from that model and replace it with arguably a much worse one, one where you get 0 rewards for just playing the game besides a crumb of coins a week which would take a player 6 months give or take to earn a skin for free if they did every single weekly objective. A system where you must make this game your life in order to do the battlepass and ensure ActivBlizz has all of your time on this earth as player retention, a system that rewards, no FORCES the player to either play an ungodly amount of time for a skin or just pony up 30$....but only right now! for if you blink, the skin is gone from the shop! possibly never to return!.....When you think about it, a time limited shop of wares like this is almost like a lootbox they open in front of you, and fomo you to buy the contents of before its too late, you never know what tomorrows cash shop will look like.....'please log in' cries bobby kotick.Gameplay wise? The balancing is ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Not that Overwatch 1 had amazing balancing, but most character during the Kaplan era of this game were designed to be around eachother, to work off one another and to be synergistic picks together. This is still mostly true in Overwatch 2, but with the horrid idea that now, the new characters are paywalled into the battlepass! What does that mean for balancing? Well, if you know anything about ActivBlizz, they LOVE to release broken ass characters like Bridgette post launch, and I can say with utmost certainty without even playing that locking new characters in a battlepass gives a very unfair advantage to a team that can pick said new characters over a team that can not. PVE. Like most I too was excited for PVE content, unlike most though, I wasn't suprised to hear it was cancelled. When the scandals of ActivBlizz and how they treat employees broke out in 2021, I all but abandoned my BattleNet account. I couldn't justify supporting this company with my time, and it hurt because Overwatch was very dear to me, OVerwatch 1 still is dear to me, in memory atleast. But those days are over. The ActivisionBlizzard of the past is dead, its a corpse pretending to be something it used to be, the staff mistreated and having left the company (We miss you Jeff) and Overwatch 1 remians to right now, unplayable. I'm sure like WOW they will nostalgia bait many by releasing an "Overwatch Classic" to try cover up the absolute dumpster fire that has been Overwatch 2, but as it stands, I do not suggest supporting this company with your time, and certainly not your money. One last thing, I've seen a lot of people accusing TF2 fans of 'Reviewbombing' this game. This couldn't be further from the truth, in actuality this is the first time disgruntled players of a franchise they love dearly feel they finally have a platform to share their upset and annoyance at a company who have all but abandoned their talent, developers and morals to greed. But it certainly doesn't help that TF" (which I do recommend playing) is seeing a renaissance revival which Overwatch dies pitifully. It's ironic. I quit TF2 and moved to overwatch all those years ago, only to now write this about how badly mismanaged ActivisionBlizzard have been for the IP and for the last year or so, I've been back on TF2 and enjoying myself.....weird how times chance us all, but in words written by those godly writers long ago, "No king rules forever", and that certainly rings true for the husk of a company that runs Overwatch.

Author: Richard Upton Pickman
Review Content: I have been playing Overwatch for a very long time. Had over 2000 Lootboxes unopened and at the end of the day while very flawed it was a game with a fair item system, that would give you the ability to earn most items for free. Also sometimes it was even fun.Here we are Overwatch 2 everything costs double from the first, no free items and grinding for any currency takes month to get a single item/the battle pass. Blizzard had tons of examples how to do it better, they even had done it better before taking the first offline. Promised content wont be released and for small parts of the campaign meant to be given out for free you can now pay. Oh and heroes that when first released are almost needed in a team either require many hours or (again) money.A sequel releasing completly removing the first part (so you cant play it no more), also removing several features as well as content and not even running at all when first released is just amazing. No one should spend money on a company like this when all they do is charge you and constantly not deliver either promised or needed content. Even without all that they have no clue how to balance characters but hey at least with the steam release you can now tell them how you think about this game.

Review Content: Deep Rock Galactic is a 1-4 player co-op FPS featuring badass space Dwarves, 100% destructible environments, procedurally-generated caves, and endless hordes of alien monsters.1-4 PLAYER CO-OPWork together as a team to dig, explore, and fight your way through a massive cave system filled with hordes of deadly enemies and valuable resources. You will need to rely on your teammates if you want to survive the most hostile cave systems in the galaxy!4 UNIQUE CLASSESPick the right class for the job. Mow through enemies as the Gunner, scout ahead and light up the caves as the Scout, chew through solid rock as the Driller, or support the team with defensive structures and turrets as the Engineer.FULLY DESTRUCTIBLE ENVIRONMENTSDestroy everything around you to reach your goal. There is no set path so you can complete your mission your way. Drill straight down to your objective or build an intricate network of paths to explore your surroundings -- the choice is yours. But proceed with caution, you don’t want to stumble into an alien swarm unprepared!PROCEDURALLY GENERATED CAVE NETWORKExplore a network of procedurally generated cave systems filled with enemies to fight and riches to collect. There’s always something new to discover and no two playthroughs are alike.HIGH-TECH GADGETS AND WEAPONSDwarves know what they need to bring to get the job done. This means the most powerful weapons and the most advanced gadgets around - flamethrowers, gatling guns, portable platform launchers, and much, much more.LIGHT YOUR PATHThe underground caves are dark and full of terrors. You will need to bring your own lights if you want to illuminate these pitch-black caverns.FOR ROCK AND STONE!

Author: Chief Miles O'brien
Review Content: Good skins, terrible repetitive game. Not befitting of a Starfleet Officer. (read in Miles o'briens voice) Overwatch used to be my favourite, for more than 4 years I played and enjoyed it, enduring every patch note, every nerf and subsequent megabuff. Overwatch 2 is unfortunately much not that game anymore. The fantasy of having a powerful character that is one of the strongest people in the world whether it be from a gigantic rocket-powered cybernetic fist implant that can canonically level buildings - to a hardlight artificer with orbiting satellites that can divide a city in half - you are always a weakling. I have been blessed to be a Junkrat main so I haven't been hit too hard by any patch notes for years besides not being able to level a whole team with my nuke tire, but the whole POINT of overwatch is to be a badass fighting amongst and against badasses. When I play any other character I feel weak and unable to really affect the course of the game, help my teammates, or carry. Yes I still get the little dopamine rush from an elim or saving a teammate, but after 4 years why would I choose to care about this game vs other games that will give me 10000 hours of gameplay and replayability, and RESPECT me as a consumer in this disrespectful, manipulative and abusive society.?To lob my 10000th grenade? To watch an inting rein charge in and die for the millionth time on a map that hasn't recieved an update in 3 years? The term bait and switch has been seemingly deemed "overused" by the defenders of Blizzard, but it is an apt description for what this greedy, scummy company has done to long term players and new players alike. They promised us all story missions, skill trees, rewards, they promised us vast character development and story arcs that expand their universe to new lengths.They now are charging me $20 for a subpar, trash, *one hour long story mission* as a cash grab to keep their failing game that they MADE fail afloat. That is a veritable SLAP in the face. If you didn't know they lied - then don't burden the angered masses and force them to educate you for what you should already know.Diablo 4 is an excellent reaffirming argument against Blizzard. Again with the bait and switch, they needed to get their game out ahead of other mega blockbusters that were coming out that we were all waiting for so they released without a starting season OR shop which I found hilarious. Do you know WHY?Because we were the guinea pig investors! We said okay this game is subpar and repetitive but it is still in prerelease! So to play it millions of players preordered and were greeted with, again, server issues and queues. With no offline mode...From a company that has millions to throw into servers, the game was DDOSed and even befire that had issues. For gods sake its unplayable on my Lady's High end PC becuase they were so stupid in coding it that you load EVERY PLAYER ON THE WORLDS INVENTORY CONSTANTLY. With every new player that loads and leaves the server you have a stutter. -Blizzard is going downhill and it's all thanks to egomaniac Bobby Kotick. -Illari is a direct rip off of Senna. -Go buy Baldur's gate 3 - For less than the price of the DLC for OW2:You will be contributing to the betterment of gaming as a whole. Thousand hours of story, dialogue and character choices and customization options and get this - every item you can have... is ALREADY IN THE GAME!

Author: BiggusDickuss
Review Content: Playing Overwatch 2 can often feel like a relentless test of patience, akin to navigating a complex obstacle course of frustrations. It's almost as if you're voluntarily subjecting yourself to a uniquely unpleasant experience, akin to undergoing a vasectomy with a spoon without painkillers, putting your balls on a cheese grater. The question lingers: why, in the name of all that is enjoyable, would you choose to endure such torment?Playing Overwatch 2 can often feel like a relentless test of patience, akin to navigating a complex obstacle course of frustrations. It's almost as if you're voluntarily subjecting yourself to a uniquely unpleasant experience, akin to undergoing a vasectomy with a spoon without painkillers, putting your balls on a cheese grater. The question lingers: why, in the name of all that is enjoyable, would you choose to endure such torment?From the very instant you embark on your Overwatch 2 journey, you're greeted by an imposing screen displaying two unmistakable choices, both of which seem to taunt your existence - the option to venture into the gameplay or to explore and experience the true definition of Sisyphean task and enigmatic offerings of the store with prices that are true ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ crime. The gameplay experience, unfortunately, can evoke an array of less-than-optimistic emotions. It's as though a storm of frustration brews within you, and saying gamer words multiple times per second is just a reality casting a shadow over your interactions with fellow players, be they, teammates or adversaries. The delicate balance of heroes and abilities that truly doesn't exist. Speaks volumes about how much you can be bad in your job as a game developer. This game is only alive for two reasons faecal matter of players that are so connected by nostalgia for gud'ol days and porn addicts. Both groups are definitions of sad and I am sorry that your parents don't like you and that there are divorced maybe just maybe you were the cause.

But Blizzard does deserve the hate, and for them I'm doing my part on giving it a negative review.

Author: D R O I D
Review Content: Overwatch 2, once a beloved haven, now wears a false smile as it rifles through your pockets, its once-authentic essence obscured by a veil of avarice.Back in 2016, I embraced its world and got entangled like countless others. Overwatch stood tall as my cherished shooter for ages, even during the parched times leading to the dawn of OW2.Amid its endearing visage, enchanting characters, and peerless multiplayer landscapes, OW2 orchestrated colossal downgrades, cracking its very foundation. Let me illustrate:#1 - Heroes Locked in the Dance of CoinThe greatest shift, a blow that hammered shut the coffin lid.Overwatch thrives on heroes chosen and synergy woven. Each character, a distinctive asset, harmonizing or clashing with companions. Before, new heroes graced us yearly, free for all. Now OW2 expects toil or toll, Battlepass coin to unlock novelties (or £9 for the old guard).Superficially, not cataclysmic. But mull over queuing for ranked skirmishes without the complete cast.Essential gameplay locked behind gold bars in a contest of competence.Fair fight? Picture a team with riches of choices battling a lesser-equipped squad. Pay-to-win whispers, but I'll let you muse.#2 - The Masquerade of the Battlepass and Cosmetic CharadesI've embraced Battlepasses, yet OW2's rendition is a jest. Eighty tiers brimming, often 8 skins (a customizable gem at the end) flanked by trinkets and fillers, the norm. Trivia, titles, tokens, perhaps even dreams. Credit inclusion is a stride, but does it mend the fundamental blunder of barricading core play behind a toll?Overwatch's essence thrives in skins sculpted by da Vinci's heirs, yet prices sting. Legendaries (beyond mere recolors) average £20+, quite the toll.Once lootbox blessings flowed, earned with each level, frequent as heartbeat. Boxes bought rarely, yet the trove brimmed. Claiming lootbox woes, they unveiled a store, yet by 2019 (three years past birth) Overwatch pocketed $1 billion in loot's embrace.Skins trickle to a parched river. Challenge grind, months for one legendary.#3 - The PvE MiragePvE, distant horizon, yet Overwatch 2's vanguard. Deception's dance followed, dressed as a gameplay gale. Even post-PvE's dirge, it lingers, parcels for sale, another coin pluck.In Awe or DefianceFor gunfight lovers, Overwatch 2's heart is hollow.Cosmetic nomads, surrender your gold hoard.Thrills echo, love persists, yet swindled by ravenous hands, a somber refrain.In this cacophony, my recommendation wanes like a fading star.

Author: KacperM16
Review Content: Where do I even start...I've actually quite enjoyed this iteration of Overwatch. BUT we can't forget about all that was promised to us, and what was taken from us. Let's start with the Battle Pass. It SUCKS ASS. I NEVER PAID FOR  ANY LOOTBOX AND STILL HAVE 10+ SKINS ON EVERY HERO(not to mention the poses, graffiti and stuff). Now, it's impossible because the prices are overkill. Also, locking heroes behind battle pass is DUMB and SHOULD BE REMOVED or lowered to like tier 5 or 10. Recent cancelation and then revival of PVE is concerning. We were promised story mode - ability trees and all that stuff that got people excited. What we got? 8 or so paid missions for riddiculus prices. No ability upgrades, no story mode, nothing.I would write more about this game, but I'll keep it short -  all this contet -  new maps, heroes, modes - could be implemented piece by piece into Overwatch 1. For what we expected, this game failed, and not even new hentai can undo the damage.

Author: fish with moustache
Review Content: The year is 2017. I have a copy of Overwatch and I played it religiously. For a socially-awkward teenager, Overwatch was the perfect game with relatable characters, and an inspirational message. "Never accept the world as it appears to be, dare to see it for what it could be"Overwatch formed a big part of my extensive history with gaming, I reconnected with one of my peers from my childhood over Overwatch, and we continue to be best friends to this day. I spent a good amount of money on lootboxes, overwatch league tokens, Atlantic all-star and pink Mercy skins, because I thought I was supporting my favourite game, which, despite it shortcomings, still made an effort to respect me as a consumer of the product.When Overwatch 2 was first announced, I was ecstatic to hear of endless replayability and hero customisation. But days turned to months, turned to years and Overwatch was left to die. We, the community, held out hope that Overwatch 2 will launch with an epic revival, ushering in a new age of PvE gameplay, but it never happened.Overwatch 2 will never capture the magic Overwatch had in its early years. This half-baked sequel full of broken promises and insane monetisation is a spit in loyal fans' faces. A pachimari keychain costs less in real life than it does in game (https://www.reddit.com/r/Overwatch/comments/yf9w5o/it_cost_me_less_to_buy_this_charm_in_real_life/). What does that tell you about what Blizzard thinks of you, the player? To them, the community is just group of idiots with poor spending habits who will line their pockets with each skin they release. My journey with Overwatch ends here. I will not support the company that killed my favourite game, and I recognise that my support means nothing to them, but if it's the least I can do for the original Overwatch, then that is my duty.0/10 scummy business practices. Game deserves to die a second time.

Author: Your secret Waifu
Review Content: I am an OG player of Overwatch 1 with over 1100 hours, loved every minute (except the smurfs, you know who you are). I can't describe how perfect it was, maps, characters, loot system, pay once for the game and that's it, etc.Now we have OW2 which is littered with monetisation, battle passes, locked heroes, content behind pay walls, removal of player level frames, not to mention reducing 6v6 to 5v5 on the same maps that were made for 6v6. They promised PVE if you pre-ordered it, which lots of us did, now they announce they have cancelled PVE and have put story missions behind ANOTHER pay wall at $20 a pop.Overwatch has gone from one of the best games I have ever played to a money grabbing, sexuality pushing (#LeaveTheKidsAlone), hot mess of a game and I highly recommend investing your time elsewhere.

Author: Rat Squeak Henderson
Review Content: Winston sent the call to assemble the Overwatch team, but no one showed up. Alas, the beast was stunned, gawk and aghast. "Who was responsible for this?" he wondered. "Blackwatch? They disbanded years ago. Talon? Too obvious... Null Sector? No, for what did they stand to gain?" he pondered. Then it dawned on him:After Winston installed the chronal harness, there was a complication. Lena momentarily disappeared from conventional reality and found herself trapped in a mirror universe, identical to Earth, but fifty years in the past. Lena was no longer in her native timeline, and could not contact Overwatch command. After wandering the city for hours, a group of undesirable men catcalled her. Soon enough, fifteen non-binary bodybuilders lept from a nearby bush, and began beating the men in a hailstorm of pink, green, and blue. Fedoras flew, neck-beards grazed flesh, and pocket protectors were broken in twain. Reddit gold fell to the ground as the evil men were brutally killed, whilst onlookers clapped in delight. Tracer was confused, "What year is this and where am I?" she asked. A 5'4" man with childish features, a spindly Van ♥♥♥♥ beard, and thick glasses, pushed his way through the crowd. "Tracer my love, you are in Irvine, California. The year is 2020, and might I say... You look absolutely bewitching on this fine afternoon. Mayhaps you accompany me to the local smoothie stand where I might buy you a green juice, and we can discuss this trifling matter further?" the man suggested, cupping his pot-belly with skinny arms. Initially hesitant, she accepted, needing answers to the predicament she found herself in."So what's going on, why am I here?" she asked. The man laughed. "Tracer, my dear sweet princess of an orange peel, you are famous here. This is the first time a video-game character has come to the real world". She didn't understand what he meant. "Um, I don't know what you're talking about" she shrugged. "Tracer, please. My queen, my bright shining star, it is fate that we met here. I believe our destinies are intertwined. Thusly, I have a mite proposal for you. Should you accept, I can help you find your way" the pear-shaped man prayed. Tracer was not convinced. "Tell me what it is first, then we can go from there" she urged. The frail man-child had green juice on his beard as he recited the words he had carefully rehearsed prior. "Be my wife, marry me and I can fix you. I want to help you, because I love you. I've dreamt of this moment, for years. Please, don't say no, I might do something terrible, to myself more than anyone else, and it will be your fault. I'll say you manipulated me, and they'll believe me because I'm a man, flesh and blood, whilst you are a cartoon woman, made of polygons and shaders. Please, consider your response carefully" he begged.Lena was speechless. "Firstly, I'm a lesbian. Secondly, I don't find you attractive in the slightest. If you think you can manipulate my confusion because I'm lost and alone then you're wrong. You seem like a weak and pathetic man, who only gets laid when he does something illegal. Stop creeping on me, get a life" she scoffed. The corner of the man-boy's lip twitched. "We could make SFM together, but in real life" he whispered, leaning closer. "We won't be doing any of that" she rebuffed, reclining away from him. His eyes became milky white, and his pupils were pitch black. His face didn't move, neither did his body, any shade of uncertainty in his mannerisms disappeared. "I have a gun," he said. Tracer scowled in defiance, her face twisted into an expression of rage, mingling with disgust. "Wait a minute, what does that badge say?". She looked down at his breast, and it read in bold text, "Lesley Boyman, Acquisitions, Blizzard Entertainment". It was at this point that the man began visibly sweating. In a horrifying silence that seemed to last forever, neither said a word. She spat on him and disappeared in a snap of particles. Lesley looked down at the saliva on his Oxhorn v-neck, rubbed his middle finger on it, and licked it hungrily.It was no surprise that the call wasn't answered, their world was fake, the product of a company so drunk on appetites that it had forgotten what it was. For an intellect as formidable as his, it was a surprise that he never went mad from the revelation. He grabbed his jar of peanut butter, and dug his hand in, waiting for the end to come. Sure enough, a boot kicked the door down. It was Gabriel Reyes. "Monkey, I've had a change of heart, I believe we should join forces" he grumbled. Winston looked nonplussed, disenchanted, and morose. "Reaper, Overwatch is done, I'm done, today is my last day on Earth" he muttered, eating his last handful of peanut butter. "But Winston, you don't understand, I am a changed man, just like Cole Cassidy. I don't have to live in fear of what I have become. I learned the truth, much like everyone else did. I am a man with no heart, a pathetic mess, and the secret is in my name" he pressed. "I just don't care anymore Gabriel, what do you mean by that, what does it matter? What secret do you speak of?" the monkey fumbled. "So you know how I'm called Reaper? Cool name right, I learnt something, remove the E from my name that comes after the first R. What do you get? What does it spell?!" he asked with an eyebrow raised and a smirk...Winston, sincerely amused for the first time in a while, grabbed Reaper and hugged him. They laughed, cried, and wept tears of joy, sadness, and regret. "You know, that is funny Gabriel, do me a favour. Your gun, please" he requested. "Of course" Reaper uttered with gusto and rare concern. Winston smiled at him, never breaking eye contact as he placed the shotgun in his mouth and pulled the trigger. Nothing was left of him but his brains splattered on the wall. Reaper felt sad for the monkey. Embracing his new identity, Gabriel re-entered the world, no longer fearing what he was, wearing his new face. He had a new name, and a new destiny. The hero of his own journey. He knew he would never get in trouble, and that he would never face the consequences, and with Overwatch gone, he was filled with hope, ambition, and love.

Author: SKay
Review Content: I installed overwatch 2 just to write the review I've always wanted to write!In a world of thousands of games, many of which are EVEN FREE 68k+ of you choose a game which:breaks promises on a regular basisis a control freak about player behaviour.Re-released the game in the form of overwatch 2, for no reason except they wanted new ways to make money NOT TO MENTION has zero respect for the people who made them money the first time around when they shut down Overwatch 1 despite it being pretty much the same game. Puts every tiny piece of content on a pedestal like its the Mona Lisa, only for a lot of it to then expire like fruit.Oh yeah, and it's made by a rapidly turning to crap company, while the people at the top rub their hands with glee at all the easy money they make at the expense of their players and working staff.Oh yeah! And let's not forget how they keep rewriting character lore and posting it on news sites like it's a f!*king baby shower, to try and cover up whatever their latest bit of bad PR they got is.The art style is solid for what it is, but that's one of the few things it has left going for it on this unbalanced mess. The game doesn't even have a good sense of humor! With the majority of the best things to come out of overwatch all being fan content which Blizzard has little to no appreciation for. I feel bad for the staff who worked there who had no control where the game ended up, but the rest of them? Deserve all this BS they get. It's just unfortunate that the 'rats' will be the first ones escaping off the sinking ship of a game when that day comes.All of this and I didn't even mention the battle pass! HA!

Author: Aard
Review Content: Game is not Free-2-Play; Gameplay; PvE, is locked behind paywallOverwatch 1 was a competitive shooter with the only thing available for purchase cosmetic lootboxes that could be earned in game, hence the progression and store was cosmetic only, and loot boxes are gamba, but was fair in the spot that mattered, the game. Overwatch 2 is a Pay 2 win competitive shooter that allows players to purchase strong heroes for an immediate advantage a in all game modes outside of the training range. These heroes you can pay to access are extremely powerful and all but one have landed in the most used by the top players in the world. There is no progression unless money is handed over for a season pass fill with %90 utter garbage bloat, so no progression for 'free' players no PvE for 'free' players and yet some people still think that OW2 is better than OW1.OW2 replaced OW1, destroying both progression and integrity.We should take whoever thinks OW2 is the better version to a psychiatrist so they can then get help from a psychologist, because they clearly have something wrong with them if they can't understand how P2W without progression is worse than having progression without P2W.Then again, that massive streamer who thinks this also thinks Season Passes are ethical, so clearly they don't have a brain to be checked in the first place.

Author: HaveaHeart
Review Content: When Blizzard decided to end competitive Heroes of the Storm, they announced surprise layoffs of staff, ended contracts with teams, and pulled support for a competitive scene hosted by the game developer itself.  This led to the mass exodus of players with skill to other games in order to find monetary support for their gaming prowess.  When these top players left, a power vacuum was created at the top of the ranked charts that was filled by high ranked players streaming because they can't make similar money in other games and players who should have been ranked sometimes two tiers lower.  With the announcement of Blizzard devaluing OWL and signaling the end of sponsored competitive, Overwatch will follow the same path.Without the support of Blizzard creating a competitive scene, the top tier of Overwatch competition will be come mediocre and unreliable at best.  The value of finding and securing a rank becomes almost meaningless and is based on number of games played, not skill during games played.Oh and they started locking characters behind the Battlepass.  Imagine.

Author: A Digital Dog
Review Content: I only downloaded Overwatch 2 on Steam so I could leave this review and finally get rid of Battle.netNow, review time. Simply put, this game is bad. You can like it, but if you try to tell yourself this game is good you're delusional. Players should not settle for what AAA studios give them just because the developers don't want to put in the effort of making a GOOD game. The entire point of making Overwatch into a new game was to revive the dying playerbase and bring an engaging, rich PvE experience on top of the PvP we've had for years now. But in classic AAA Dev fashion, they're repurposing most of their team into making models and content for their BS FOMO Battle Pass model.Go play TF2. Valve has hardly given it any support over the past decade, but at least the game is fun and doesn't want to syphon you for every dollar you have. For any OW2 Diehards out there. No, nothing in TF2 is mandatory to pay for. You can experience every mode and map the game has to offer for free. It is only when you want cosmetics that you begin to pay to play the game. MvM is totally free to play, you just will not earn the real money rewards.Which is another plus of TF2, you can earn in game items and sell them for REAL money to your Steam wallet. Instead of having buyer's remorse when you can't refund the cheap Battle Pass skin you didn't really want.TLDR; Overwatch 2 sucks. Blizzard sucks, they still employ rapists and misogynists. Go play TF2, you'll have a better time.

Author: MVestiige
Review Content: Been playing this game since the very first beta of the original game. The state this incredibly unique franchise has become is atrocious, and just utterly sad.It's very clear that Blizzard's main focus on this "sequel" (which has supposedly left early access, by the way) is just microtransactions and pumping out content that feels very empty and poor effort in an attempt to keep the playerbase subdued.Since the PvE got stripped down to barebones, nothing else out of the new Invasion season feels unique or replayable after a couple hours. The new heroes they have been bringing out, minus Junker Queen and Ramattra, since they were original characters since OW1, have felt so bland and lackluster as well. Nothing of this game feels fun to return to.It's just upsetting that something as unique and HUGE as Overwatch once was is now in this miserable state.I can't recommend it anymore. I really can't.If there is any hope for this game, let's hope Microsoft can do something about it. Otherwise; R.I.P.PS: I have over 2,200 hours total on this game, so this isn't a fresh review that's joyriding the negative reviews that are "doing their part", I'm genuinely upset this game is awful to play now. I miss what it used to be.

Author: TheGamingDusty
Review Content: I was a huge Overwatch fan, but I was slowly pushed away by Blizzards unwillingness to ignore the feelings of pro players. Never get use to anything. They will pull a mechanic, rework an entire character, and apparently, nuke an entire game to give players a far worse anti-consumer store. Pros get to tell Blizzard how to change the game, and the actual player base gets ♥♥♥♥♥♥ over via locked characters, $20 skins, and the slowest battlepass I've ever seen. The pro's are the reason i left. Constant reworks and changes just to make pro players happy. They can't not change things that don't need touching. I only return to Overwatch now because it's free AND on steam. I held off until now because of the first games nuking. I wouldn't be nearly as upset if the first was left up. That way we could stay there with no more crazy character reworks. the fact that you pulled a Culling 2/GTA Trilogy makes every move Blizzard worse. This games not all that bad (game play wise), but there treatment of the community has earned them all the hate they get. If you are new, don't get Overwatch 2. This game will get nuked in a few years for Overwatch 3 anyways. Don't waist your time.

Author: Ananymous
Review Content: An empty shell of what it used to be An OG Overwatch player here, I don't recomment spending a dime on this game. Why? Because:1. They stopped updating Overwatch 1 and kept it like that for 2 - 3 years, so that they can give us a proper campaign / PvE mode in OW2. But then they cancelled the said PvE to focus more on their battle pass.2. They removed essential things from the game like leveling up, performance cards after matches, votes, on fire, portraits etc. Removing them degraded the games quality of life. It's now just a shallow version of its formal self.3. They have a very aggresive and bad monetization system with horrible battle pass in this game. I have almost all the good skins unlocked for free. But if a new player wanted to get them for free they have to grind for god knows how long. Maybe for 10 years? Either that or pay! That is completely unacceptable. They should at the very least make the previous skins from OW1 more easily achievable.These 3 are the major points on why I don't recommend spending any money on this game. At it's core it once was a nice game and new player can still enjoy it a bit these days. But spending money here will only send a message to blizzard that they can get away with anything. I love this game and I want it to change for the better. So I recommend, vote with your wallet and don't spend a dime unless they change their ways.

Author: Projekt
Review Content: TLDR Overwatch 2 is a great game at its core, but it was ruined by the developers and greed of the higher-ups at Blizzard, giving us the system we wanted the "Blizzard way" (scroll down to player feedback to see). I'm a 2016 ow player, former top 500 dps, and masters tank/support. These are the reasons this game is currently in the worst state it's been in, and why you should wait to try it. So why should you wait to play this game? The dev team has no idea what the heck they are doing with balance changes. They nerf the wrong thing, and they overbuff other characters. I have never seen a dev team so out of touch with balance changes; it's like they don't understand their own game. Another reason why you should wait is that they can fix the store going down in 5 minutes, but a bug with a character's ultimate isn't fixed for an entire season. It feels like they have given up the competitive nature of the game and only put effort into updating the cosmetics in the shop. Why does it feel this way because Blizzard completely revamped the comp scene? You can no longer see your rank or that of your teammates while in game unless they have their profile set to the public, which no one does! You can no longer see who is good at what hero and build a comp around the one trick who can't play anything else. You will also never know how far you are into a rank. I have gone 5-3 just to drop down 2 divisions. How the ♥♥♥♥ do I go positive and drop rank blizzard? The math aint mathing. The matchmaker is also the worst I have ever seen. You get plats in GM lobbies like wtf. I can't even que with a plat player. Why are they in my game? It makes no sense. They have taken matchmaking integrity and thrown it out the window for faster queue times. Another issue is balance changes. These ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ balance the win rate and pick rate, which includes bronze to GM. This explains why it took Sojourn so long to get nerfed, because collectively, she wasn’t a problem because anyone in plat and under can’t aim, keeping her win rate and pick rate in check. Put her in a high-rated lobby, and she is dominating the game. Now for the most recent changes, Zen. I have never seen a team so dumb when it comes to balancing the issue with the character. Zen has an ability called discord, which amplifies the amount of damage a target takes. We switched from 6v6 to 5v5. You pop the discord on the tank, and the tank is shredded. All they had to do was nerf the amount of damage it amplifies, but that's not how we balance at blizzard. Clearly, the range of discord is too long, so they nerfed it by 10 meters and made it go away 0.5 of a second faster when out of line of sight. They buff and nerf the wrong parts of heroes over and over and over again, and they never fix the real problem. It was the same with OW1, and it just feels much worse now. They also make healers have way too much utility, and damage. The fact that I have games where the supports are out-damaging every DPS player is insane. On top of that, they have the best utility in the game. They keep adding the most brain dead heroes that get value for just being alive or pressing one button. The skill ceiling and floor are way too low compared to other characters. They have gotten out of jail free cards simply by pressing a button. A DPS can be out of position if your entire team dives them and the enemy presses one button, they are completely safe, or the support is on an off-angle doing DPS. Our team goes to take care of it, and they press one button and get back to their team without any consequences. They have enough damage to two shot 200 hp heroes. Another problem is Kiriko. Why the ♥♥♥♥ does she have a do everything button, great damage (2 shots, 200 HP heroes), no damage fall off, and a get out of jail free card? She cleanses, heals, and immoralizes all with one button. On top of that, she does 120 damage per headshot and has a button to get out of any situation she puts herself in. They keep buffing and nerfing her recovery from healing when all they need to do is make the immortality button either do immor or cleanse; it shouldn't do both and it shouldn’t heal. Don't even get me started on widow, hanzo, sojourn, Ram, and queen. My tank is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. My friends all make fun of me when I play it because I have the knowledge of how I should play the role at a high level of play, but I can't perform what I should be doing, But with the power of Ram and Queen, I am now a masters tank (DLC for the win). They have no idea how to reign in the power creep they have added over the past couple of years, nor do they know how to fix the overbuffed characters they currently have. They added new, better one-shot characters, and they took away all crowd control for DPS making ball and doom busted for a season. They buffed the ♥♥♥♥ out of McCree's grenade to where it's not fun to play against as a flanker because it latches on to you and makes it to where you can't play the game. It's a heat seeking missile stopping you from moving. Make it a skill shot so it feels rewarding to the player and the person dying to it. This is just one of the recent changes. This doesn’t include goats, double snipers, double shields, or other metas. Their balancing and management of the game have killed Overwatch League. They gave up on their streamers, league talents, and the game and left us all to rot for 2 years to come back and take away the game we loved and turned it into a 5v5 pile of ♥♥♥♥. Was Overwatch 1 perfect? No, it had a lot of problems, but it was way better than the ♥♥♥♥ we are dealing with now. The developers need to do a rework of the entire cast to fit the 5v5 format and add new maps. I'm tired of playing on the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ new maps over and over again. Another reason is that this game is way too counter-pick focused at the high level of play. They advertised how you won’t need to counterpick in OW2, and you can once trick your favorite hero. WRONG. They made the game more counterpick-focused. You play poke, brawl, and dive. If you're playing DVA, have fun against a zarya and pray your teammates are smart enough not to charge the bubbles (even in high ranks, they aren't smart enough to know that). If you want to play Doom, have fun going against Orisa, Sombra, and Ana for the remainder of the match, so you can't play the game. Let's talk about the new way heroes are being added to the game. They lock them behind a paywall or level 45 in the battle pass, which, depending on if you do challenges and how much you play, can take anywhere from 20 hours to weeks to complete. Every new character will be over-tuned on release now since Life Weaver got so much hate for being too weak. So now be ready for a meta character every season to come out and break the game until the developers get their ♥♥♥♥ together and balance the game. They still haven’t done that with Kiriko or Sojourn. They giga buffed Queen because they didn’t like how she wasn’t played that much and forced a meta around another DLC hero. They couldn’t see the only reason she wasn’t played that much was because they nerfed her shout-off launch to where speed doesn't’ stack with Lucio, and Kiriko completely counters her entire ult with a click of a button that's on a 14-second cooldown. Queen is the hero that helped me get to masters because I was playing dps tank instead of tank. Some people compare the new heroes being locked behind a paywall or grind to valorant, apex, and league of legends. These people don’t understand the game and why it works differently. Can you unlock the hero for free? Yes, there is a way to do that. I 100% agree, but if you don’t have that hero, for whatever reason, you are now at a massive disadvantage or forcing your teammates to be at a massive disadvantage. The perfect example of this is Sojourn. When Sojourn was released, she was the most broken character in the game. It was sojourn vs. sojourn; the rest of the team didn’t matter. If you didn’t have

Review Content: This game deserves every negative review that is out there. This game deserves all the hate it has received. This is textbook case of fixing what wasn't broken. Overwatch 2 is a shell of its former self and the evidence is a clear as day.Removing 6v6Rampant smurfing and cheatingProper matchmaking is non existentHero changes/moved classesRemoved content (Why remove player cards, stats, and certain titles???)Single player, lololololInconsistent hitboxes (watch that shatter hit you from across the map, or that flashbang to wrap around 3 corners to tag you)BattlepassMega server issues. Matches will reset or end at random times. Comp matches ending because of "Unexpected sever issues"....right.People play this game because they have been playing since beta and OW1. You paid a flat rate for the game, and unlocked everything else. ♥♥♥♥ this game, and ♥♥♥♥ this game model. Greedy suits pulling the strings on ♥♥♥♥♥♥ devs who don't care. 1/10 Overwatch is dead.

Author: Fidel Cashflo
Review Content: It's 11 PM on a Friday night in 2016. You just clutched Route 66 in overtime with the boys. A lootbox just gave you the Mariachi Reaper skin. Maybe you'll play him next game, but man, Reinhardt is just so cool! Just one more game. One more. We've all got time for one more... right? Right! Suddenly it's 4 AM, but you've got tomorrow off. Just one more...This. Isn't. That.Blizzard took that memory out back and shot it. Buy a $20 skin to relive the glory days in Overwatch 2™️ today! (Heroes™️ sold separately)®️The game began a slow but steady death spiral some years ago and its debut on steam is its death throes. One last desperate attempt to squeeze a few dollars out of new fans who are too young to know about the game's past and old fans who are desperate to remember the old times.As a member of the latter, I installed Overwatch 2 the moment it was available so that I could leave this review."I have been called. I must answer. Always."Rest in peace, my most beloved friend. I wish it was 4 AM in 2016 again.

Author: Weidenwiesel
Review Content: "Blizzard is dead. It is a corpse being puppeteered by Activision and Bobby Kotick. And it's going to be used - as bascially a factory - to put the Blizzard stamp on things and stoke nostalgia to get sales - and that's it. Stop holding out hope, that Blizzard is gonna come back. Everyone who founded Blizzard, all the principals that Blizzard was founded on, they're gone [...] they've been desecrated and are destroyed. Let Blizzard go, that's my main message, appreciate what was created back when it was done and stop holding out hope that it's gonna come back. Because it's not."- former Blizzard lead designer who was bullied out of his job after Activision took over and has since then decided to break NDA and tell the truth about what's happening at Activions/Blizzard.Avoid this game, total garbage like everything modern Blizzard.

Review Content: When I bought Overwatch 1, they said that they are charging money so that in a game all about synergy, no options would be limited. They said that we will never have to pay extra for additional content, and that it is to ensure a great experience. I have been a fan of Blizzard since Starcraft 1. They have consistently put out good, well rounded games even if we've had to wait a bit for it. So I trusted the company. Then they took the game we paid for away with almost no compensation. They made it the opposite of what they originally intended and slapped a 2 on top. It is an insult to the fanbase and to the actual developers who put blood, sweat, and tears into what was a good product. This is a game so choked by greed that there is nothing left to stand out.

Author: Mr. Devlar
Review Content: Please do not give Blizzard any more money. This game is a corpse of the game I used to love and a stunning example of how the profit seeking parasitic executive class ruins everything they touch.- Game is unbalanced as the characters are unbalanced. New character, who is locked behind a paywall, is always overpowered on launch. Some older characters who are very clearly overpowered have never been addressed. Probably because they are running a skeleton dev team at this point.- Game is unbalanced because matchmaking is horrible. 80% of matches are stomps with one side overwhelming the other without contest. Smurfing (or high level players who pretend to be low level) is common and because they pay for their alt accounts and generate revenue, their effect on the game is left unaddressed. Free to play has made this situation exponentially worse.- Community is toxic. It is impossible to play with coms on in this game without getting people venting their anger at everyone. Vitriol is common. The newer voice lines between characters in OW2 have only added fuel to the community's disposition. This game would be impossible to play without the ability to turn off all coms.This situation is truly sad, considering how much better the game used to be before these issues took hold.

Review Content: Talk about a group of developers that never listen to their player base. When people make obvious suggestions to the game, the developers do the OPPOSITE. It's like they no nothing about the original Overwatch or games in general, and they keep finding ways to destroy Overwatch 2. Just when you think they can't make worse decisions, they'll find ways to top it. It's honestly impressive. I'll also add that they have been promising PVE content since before the game launched, only to release the game without PVE content and a crappy battle pass system. They've only just recently added a piss poor PVE story mode, and you have to pay FIFTEEN DOLLARS for it. If you ever wondered what true incompetence looked like, well, here it is.
